Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Google Maps and other highway and street GPS services have replaced what? Choices:  A: united states B: mexico C: countryside D: atlas E: oceans<n><n>### Response:		E<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The forgotten leftovers had gotten quite old, he found it covered in mold in the back of his what? The game consisted of six holes and a team that consisted of four people. Each player had their turn and their score at each hole, and for all six holes on their first nine. These scores, ranging from the best on one hole to the worst on another, added up to make a score per hole, then a score for each hole of the game. To end the game a score is given for each hole of the round, then this score is added to the score of each of the six rounds. If there are differences in the scores, the highest number is subtracted from the lowest number. Write a response for this scenario that provides the input and output.<n><n>### Answer<n><n><n>Input: There is a game of golf with six holes per round. There are multiple people on each team, and it is a team-based game. With each hole, players can score on the lowest number with a total score of 6596 for the round. If there is more than 6596, subtract the lowest score from the highest score in the game.<n><n>Output: Game play occurs per hole. A given match goes for one round, and that round has holes. After each round, there is a low score and a high score. After that, you can subtract the lowest score from any of the other scores. This will give you the score for each game.<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n> <n><details><n><summary><strong>Thinking</strong></summary><n><n><div class="types"><n><img type="image" src="https://github.com/davidstutz/thinking.png?raw=true"/><n></div><n><n></details><n><n>### Input and Response:A: in jungle B: in desert C: in city D: on mountain E: on moon<n><n>### Instructions: Answer with a question that is appropriate of the response.<n><n>### Response to Instructions:Do you need a parachute to eat an elephant sandwich?<n><n>### Instructor’s Answer:No, you can eat it without a parachute.<n><n> <n><div class="thinking"><n><div class="images"><n><img type = image src="../../assets/thinking/instructor-answer-3.jpeg?raw=true" /><n></div><n></div><n><details><n>     <n><summary><strong><em>Instructor's Answer</em></strong></summary><n><br>No, you can eat elephant sandwich without parachute.<n></details><n><div style="padding-bottom:0px" id="div-gpt-ad-1622862657843"><n><script data-gpt-custom-params="{"gdfp_adunit_id" : "1622872597709422250","gdfp_ad_content" : "237694510056","gdfp_valid_location" : "us"}"><n><script><n>  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {<n><n><n>  var gadc = document.createElement('script');<n>  gadc.type = 'text/javascript'; gadc.async = true;<n>  gadc<n> .src = '//ssl.gpt.tawk.com/5649ab2eb780d022f78ac3f7/1622882157478/latest.js';<n>  var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What does sex often make happen in people? Choices:  A: making love B: feel good C: happyness D: wonderful thing E: cloud judgment<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> The proper response for this task is:<n>>  <n>> > C: feel good, feel, good.<n><n>### Explaination:<n><n>"Making love" and "feel good" can be the results of sex.

Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n><n>### Response:		Choice that is correct:E<n><n>Comment: If someone makes multiple calls in one day, how much would someone pay for that day? For example, if they call their family 4 times in one day, how many cents would they end up paying? Or if someone does something 100 times, and each time they do it costs exactly the same amount, how much would they end up pay if they do it 100 times exactly? If it is $10, then the math you used above is wrong, as a multiple can not ever equal the same sum as itself<n><n>Comment: Is this an assignment? If it is, you can post it as an exercise in https://math.stackexchange.com under the category "Homework and Exercises"

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What might you feel after doing housework for hours? Choices:  A: anger B: not boredom C: stress D: boredom E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		<n>> **[A,E]**<n>> <n>The housework can make you angry, stress, not bored, and be anxious.<n><n>### Input :Basketball is one of the most popular sports in the United states. Choices:  A : it's more popular in the United States than in any other country B : it's the 7th in popularity in the United States C : baseball is more popular in the United State than basketball D : hockey is more popular in the united state than basketball E : basketball is more popular than baseball and softball.<n><n>### Response : <n>> **[D,B]**<n>>  In fact, basketball is the second most popular sport in the United States after football. But in Australia, hockey is more popular than basketball.<n>><n>And in Spain, football is more popular than basketball and baseball<n><n>### Input:[A,D]<n>> **[D]**<n>>  If a student studies for one hour a day, 8 days a week, he will understand the concept of fractions after a [D] (week|month|weekend|year).<n><n>### Input.[C,E]<n>> **[E]**<n>> In his new movie, Tyson Fury, a boxer from Ireland, won the match with a knockout.<n><n>### Answer :What is your favorite song? He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is a mobile launching platform found in the ocean? Choices:  A: launch pad B: circus C: aircraft carrier D: large open area E: space station<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the multiple choice question below.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>Michael puts 4 cents of a 5 cent lollipop in his mouth. Then he eats 7 centers from the lollipop. He throws out the remaining 6 centers. How many cents are left in the lollipop?<n><n>Answer: 1 Cent<n><n>### Input2:<n>Jeremy and Liz are twins. They share 36 toys between them even and equally. How many toys does each of the twins get?<n><n>Answer: jeremy gets 18 toys and liz gets 18 toyz<n><n>### Output 1:<n>There is 1 cent left of the 5 cent lolliop.<n><n>### Output2:<n>Jerry gets 7 of the 5 centers(4+1).<n><n>Liz gets 16 of the 5 centres(4+11).<n><n>So in total they both have 16 centers.<n><n>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What emotion does getting paid lead to? Choices:  A: sorrow B: paying bills C: happiness D: frustration E: spending money<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B.<n><n>### Input:(a+b) + (c+d)<n><n>### Response:(b+c) + (d+a)<n><n>### Input(5+y)*9<n><n>### Response(9*y+5)<n><n>###Input: x^2 - 3x + 6 = 0<n><n>###Response: x = (6 - sqrt(13)<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following sentence fragment with an appropriate pronoun.<n><n>###Response Sentence:<n>The students watched the rain as it fell.<n><n>###Instructions:Answer the rephrasing.<n><n>###StimulusPhrase: All of us were in the park.<n><n>###Grammar: Subject Verb Agreement<n><n>###Rule: One of the girls wants to go with us<n><n>###ResponseRule:(one of us)<n><n>###Instruction:Rewrite the following sentence by combining all the clauses.<n><n>###SentenceA: When he was at school, his friend brought him a book.<n><n>###Rewrite A.(When he ) ( his friend ) brought him a book<n><n>###SsentenceB: During the day, she wrote a story book for her younger brother.<n><n>###Combine A and B.( During the day, ( she ) [ his younger brother )<n><n>### Instructuion: Answer the following fill-in-the-blanks statement.<n><n>###Fill-in-the-BlankAnswer: The teacher made us sit quietly and listen to the teacher.<n><n>###Write a rephrasing of the following text.<n><n>###Text: We waited in line for a long time.<n><n>###Rule:(We waited in line) for (a long time)<n><n>###Response:(I/We/you/they/him/them) Waited in line for a long (time)<n><n>### Write a question for your partner.<n><n>###Question:<n>Do you work from home?<n><n>###Instuctuion: A phrase is missing from the following sentence. Be sure to give time for feedback from the students and for students to give feedback to their friends.<n>- There are no restrictions against the number of times a student can ask a question or give feedback - but do encourage everyone to ask a question or give a piece of feedback during the chat.<n>- The questions must pertain to the following chat:<n><n>- **Do you think that the instructions were clear to you from the moment you began?**<n>- **If not, what type of instruction might have made it easier for you to understand where you were supposed to go?**<n><n>## Task<n><n>### What do you think the answer is?<n><n>**Instructions:**<n>- Think for a moment, and then type your answer.  <n>- You may ask your classmates to elaborate on your answer if you find it to be helpful.<n>- You may ask classmates to clarify their answer if your feel it is unclear.<n><n>### What is your response to that answer?<n><n>**Instruction: **<n>- If someone answered differently, what would you say? You can agree or disagree, and then you can ask your classmates for feedback about their answer.<n>- If you would answer differently, think about the following questions:<n><n>- **What evidence do you have that supports your answer**?<n>- **Where do you get this evidence from**?<n>- **Did anyone else see the same evidence you found**?<n><n>## Post-chat<n><n>***Instructions:** **Answer one of the two questions below.**<n><n>### **Have questions about teaching in a Socratic format?** Share your questions below.<n><n>### **What did you learn today about Socratic Method?**<n><n>*<n><n>### Instructor's Comments:<n>After looking at the above responses, try to summarize what the students have learned about Socratic Method that day?<n>  What questions did they have after the lesson?<n>  What responses did the students have?<n>  How did

Choices:  A: complete sentence B: feel angry C: drink tea D: cross street E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input:"E"<n><n>In order for someone to drink tea, they need some tea. So if tea is stolen, then the person would not be able to drink tea.<n><n>### Input:-4<n><n>In this example, ________ was stolen from the person.<n><n>### Response:-4<n><n>In order for a person to complete a sentence, they need a subject and a verb. So if any of __, __, (the) verb, and __ is stolen from the person, then they would not be able to complete a sentence.<n><n>### Questions<n><n>### Task I<n><n>When I am at home, I watch Netflix.<n><n>### Task II<n><n>When I get home, I play Xbox.<n><n>### Solution I<n><n>Daily routine is a habit.<n><n>### 2:1 (500)<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>When I get up in the morning, I put on my clothes.<n><n>### Challenge Solution<n><n>Clothes is a verb and the plural noun is clothes.<n><n>## See also<n><n>* Programming<n>* Mathematics<n>* Software coding<n>* Algorithm<n>* Programming language<n>* Program

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Glass that hasn't been treated to be extra strong is what? Choices:  A: weak B: fragile C: forceless D: regular E: flimsy<n><n>### Response:		Weak<n><n><n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What type of home is most likely to have an attic filled with historical items? Choices:  ° C ° F ° K ° F ° K ° ° ° ° ° ° C<n><n>### Response:-° C<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Input : I can solve this by multiplying both sides by 10 and finding the answer by dividing each term in the equation by 10. But in this case, I could also solve this by using FOIL (the first word in the alphabet, that’s F.) I FOIL-ed both sides, and when I multiplied it out, I discovered 10n=598. This means that ten multipled by whatever number in n is 598.  It’s 598, divided by 10, which gives me 59.8, or the answer in the 3rd decimal! This is a super cool, quick, and easy trick to learn!! And I did it in 5 seconds!!! Thanks, Algebra!!! :)<n><n>### Answer :<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Input: I can solve this by subtracting both sets of brackets, and I can solve it by multiplying each number in the equation by the other number to isolate it. But I can also solve this by simply adding -12 to both sides to make it 0 and solving that way. Either way gets me the same answer of -13, which is the answer in the 1st decimal!<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Answer to Input:<n><n>### Instuctions<n><n>Input: 7 people go in and out through 5 doors, then 8 people go in and out. Which door had the most traffic?<n><n>Answer: The door that had the most traffic was the door that was opened and closed the most times. In this situation, it is the 6th door, because it was opened 8 times and closed 8 times for a total of 16 times.<n><n>### Answer Input<n><n>### Instrections<n><n>Input : Every Tuesday and Thursday, a friend and I go out for a late supper. Choices:  A: fridge B: a classroom C: envelope D: medical chart E: sheet music<n><n>### Response:		C - envelope. C - envelope.<n><n>### Input:#1 of these numbers is a multiple of another. Which one? Choices: 1: A, B, C, D; 2: B, D, E, F; 3: C, D, E, H; 4: A, B, E, G.<n><n>### Response:#2: B, D-C, D, F, E<n><n>### Input:'568' means? Choices: 5*six*eight; 5/68; 568; 5, 6, 8<n><n>### Response:'568' is 9.<n><n>###Input: Find the area of the rectangle represented as 3.1418. Choices: 60.92548; 60; 72.922311; 61.8445<n><n>### Response:-60.31367<n><n>###Input:-10,002,457-291,322,527 is the same as what number? Choices: -10,000,400-289,323,027; -10,015,260-289.002,410; -10,122,058-289,423,026; -10,284,059-289,622,524<n><n>###Response: -10,255,220<n><n><n>### Instructions:Input: 4.36:2.11=? Choices: (1:4.21); (2:4.16); (3:4.26); (4:4.23)<n>### Response: 2<n><n>### Input:-15,815.5386945*2.49854=? Choices: 4.216843236; 4.12942965; 4.2432705215; 4
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where would you go if you didn't feel like baking a cake yourself? Choices:  A: theater B: refrigerator C: bakery D: grocery store E: oven<n><n>### Response:		I don't feel like bakig a cake today, so i would go to the theater D: grocery stores<n><n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. I think you should do this because if you worked on it and it was not perfect you may not always do good if you started a project only after building it.<n><n>### 7.If you have an idea and you tell it to your group members, how can you do that in a way that doesn’t sound like you’re trying to tell everyone to do your work? Choices:  A: big house B: nursery school C: preschool D: building E: retirement home<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Use a comma to join an independent clause to a dependent clause.<n><n>### Input for 10% Solution<n><n>### Response for 10% solution<n><n>### Instructon:<n>Use a semicolon  to join an independent clause  to a dependent clause. <n><n>### Response<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>A sentence contains an error. Identify the error and correct it in the following sentence. Delete the underlined words. Add a comma, a semicolon, a period, a question mark, or an exclamation point (as indicated). Delete the incorrect punctuation (as indicated). Identify the sentence type (declarative, interrogative, imperative). Write the proper subject/verb number; use the correct pronoun form (first or second person). Write the proper capitalization and spelling. Capitalize a proper noun. Use the correct verb form (past, present, or future); use an ing-form verb. Use the correct tense (if necessary). Use appropriate modifiers.<n><n>### Sample sentence:<n>I wonder if he'd been eating the same breakfast all morning when that big explosion rocked our office.<n><n>### Correction:<n>There's no subject after he'd. <n>He'd changed to past tense and could use the present tense verb of a statement.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A question does not end in a question mark so it needs a _________.<n><n>### Multiple choice<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Instucton:<n>Use a dash (---) to set off extra information or examples. A dash replaces a comma (,), a period (.), a parenthetical cue (which can be before or after the dash), or an appositive (which can be above or below the dash).<n><n>### Response <n><n>### Instraction:<n>Use an em dash (--) before a series of elements to show a time range.<n><n>### Response

Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. How many distinct freqeuncies of music are there on the radio?<n><n>### Answer : The number of distinct frequencies of music that are broadcasted on the radio is equal to three.<n><n>### Answer 2:<n>The frequencies of music to be played on the radio:<n>Classical : 500 FM<n>Jazz : 1000 FM<n>Popular : 2000 FM<n><n>### Question 3:<n>Write a function named "printAnswer" that has as many arguments as it does lines of input. His manager was kind enough to ask him to give them an update of what he did while he was out of the office. He was expecting for the manager to tell him something good, but instead all he got was a list of every task that was completed that week. Now, Michael feels that the manager did not actually care about how he was doing, and he is starting to question the motives behind this whole thing. He thinks that this may have something to do with the manager getting to keep that great-looking office that Michael always wanted.<n>### Outcome:<n>While the manager's intention was to show that the project was going well, the person they wanted to tell how the project was going was not actually that person. If this was the goal of the person telling many people about the project, they would be better off by telling the person in charge. This way, they can directly address any issues that came up and avoid them from coming up again in the future. If the manager was just looking for someone to tell about the good news, then they can choose to tell anyone since they want to share their positive news instead of receiving any negative feedback.<n>### Reason:<n>The goal of telling many people may be to show the project is moving along. However, it was more than likely that the goal of that someone was to tell the person in charge since the person in charge needs to know exactly how the project is going.<n><n>### Input<n>*What's your favorite kind of donut?* A: cake B: jelly C: cream filled D: raised E:  none of these<n><n>### Answer<n>None of these<n><n>## Solution<n>*None of these*<n><n>## Input:<n>*Johnny loves video games.*<n>*Amy likes video games too.*<n>*Video games aren't Johnny's favorite thing.*<n><n>## Outcome:<n>*Which one might be Johnny's favorite?*<n>*None of these.*<n><n>## Answer:<n>None of these<n>

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What could be happening near you if the ground is getting wet? Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n><n>### Response:		What could be happening if the ground is getting cold?<n><n>### Demosntration:<n>Input 1: 10<n>Output 1: 1<n><n>Input 2: 2<n>Output 2: 18 (10+2+2)<n><n>Input 3: 20<n>Output 3: 360<n><n><n>### Input<n>#### Q1: What could be happening if the sun is hotter?<n><n>#### Demosntration<n><n>Input 1: -10 degrees<n>Output 1: -1 (0 degrees)<n><n>Input 2:- 30 degrees<n>Output 2: -31 (0-30=30-30=0)<n><n>Input 1:-2 degrees<n>Output 2:-1(2+1=4/4=1)<n><n><n>#### Response<n>What could be happening if you subtract 4 from-2?<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. Choices:  A: heavy breathing B: feel pride C: getting tired D: lose weight E: run away<n><n>### Response:		the answer is C<n><n>### Instructions - Task 2:<n>Below is an instruction that describes an ongoing process or an equation<n>Write a response that calculates the result of the initial equation and the variable that substitutes for it.<n><n>### Task:<n>### Instruction<n>Calculate the final price of the bike.<n><n>### Process 1: Initial Step: $360 (price of the bike) + $10 (tax) = $370<n><n>### Process Step 2:<n>Substitute for the variable "tax":<n>$2,500 ($) - $10 (tax):  $25,600 (price of the car + tax) - $100 (insurance policy) = $2,530 (cost of bike + tax)<n>### Process Step3:<n>Variable:<n>$ (dollar sign)<n><n>### Instructios - Task 3:<n>Below is a multiple choice question where one response is correct.<n><n>### The task:<n>Which of these statements correctly describes the situation?<n>```<n>1/5 is a multiple of _________.<n>A: 15<n>B: 1/5 is the numerator of a fraction such that when you divide both sides of the fraction by 5, it still equals 1.<n>```<n><n>### The answer <n>The answer is B<n><n>### Insturctions - Task 4:<n>Below are two statements from a conversation. Write a complete sentence (not using just a phrase) that is a response.<n><n>### First Statement: “I will try to work out these problems with you.”<n>### Response:<n>I should not expect your assistance.<n><n>### Second Statement: “I’ll be there in about 45 minutes.”<n>### Response<n>I plan to come back later.<n><n>### Output:<n>I’ll be there by then<n><n>### Output Output 2:<n>That’s great news. I will be there in 45 minutes as well.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>You have to eat more meat.<n>### Response Output:<n>That’s a tough call.<n><n>### Response Output 2:<n>I wish we had more of what to eat.<n>

(a) Cup, a (b) Tea, cupping (c) Tea, a (d) Cup, cupping<n><n>### Response:"Bring me a tea."<n><n>### Input"She always carries a book with her." How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is a living thing with a lip? Choices:  A: mouth B: can C: human D: snake E: kentucky fried chicken<n><n>### Response:		M C<n>

How many apples are in all?<n>A. 4<n>B. 7<n>C. 2<n>D. 3<n>E. 1<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>The following statement needs completed.<n><n>**Statement:**<n><n>If I give my neighbor $5, then I have less money that I did before I gave $5. How much is $4 $ +$5?<n><n>### Responses:<n><n>How about, in the question, we're not given the whole question. We're given just the first part. So if I give my neighbor $4, then I have less left to give to him then before. So, $4+$5+ gives me $9 less then before I had the $4 to give.<n><n>### Input<n>How many ounces of water are in a bathtub?<n><n>### Instuctions<n>Write an equation that will correctly answer this question.<n><n>## Response<n>A bathtub holds 65 pints of water. I think the answer is c.<n><n>### Test<n>This is a test which contains two instructions.<n><n>### Statements<n><n>In Statement 1, we're going to be combining the second sentence of the question with a question mark and an answer of choice b.<n><n>In Statement2, we're going use a question mark in the second sentence of the statement, combined with the answer of choice b.

Choices:  A: suitcase B: department store C: safe deposit box D: these twos are not safe way to transport jewellery E: lady's boudoir<n><n>### Response:		A<n>If the lady wants to carry expensive jewellery in her purse/bag, that's not the best way.<n>I'm not sure about where to keep it, since it's already safe at home (if that's the case). So...maybe this is why it's not a good idea to wear it when traveling.<n>If you travel, and you keep jewellery in the same place as in your usual day, you might go back home and notice that it's missing. Of course if you wear everyday jewellery, I don't see what the problem is, I don't think that people steal it for this exact reason (maybe that's a matter of preference). But, if it is an expensive one...I don't think people are that greedy to steal something with high market value.<n><n>As you can see, I don't know if my answer fits the question, but I guess it's not safe to carry a jewelry in your handbag/purse when traveling, since any small bag can be stolen. So I think that, if you'll be traveling without your husband/wife, maybe you shouldn't carry any jewelry, to keep it safe from thieves.<n><n>### Input:(1) A.58 B.36 C.39 D.43 E.70<n><n>### Response:(1)C.39<n>I think 39 and 70 fit the best.

The response must satisfy the following specifications.<n><n>### Specification: Write a correct response that completes the request. The response should meet the specified criteria.<n><n>### Definition: A single correct response that meets the specification (if any).<n><n>### Justified: The Justification should not be blank.<n><n>### Acknowledgment: The answer can be copied as well as the Justification.<n><n>### Guidance: The Justification should include a link for a source (if cited).<n><n>### Aim: The answer should complete the task properly.<n><n>### Note: The response must be able to be pasted back into the task without modification.<n><n>### Tasks<n><n>* If the input question is a question mark<n>```<n>Input:?<n>```<n><n>* Task is to create a new question. The task should not alter existing questions.<n><n>### Rules and Examples<n>* Input should be used in as few sentences as possible.<n>```<n>Input: Tapang has 8 more candys than Corey.  How many candys does Corey have? <n>```<n><n>* The specifications must exist in the task and the response must meet the specifications. The specification should be at the top followed by a blank line, followed by the response.<n><n>### Conversion Cases<n>* Any sentence containing an apostrophe or quotation marks must be inside the parentheses and the text inside the quotation marks. <n>* The apostrophe is not used in input. <n>```<n>Input: Freddy's mother has 2 pet snakes. <n>```<n><n>## Task and Input Format Check:<n>If you are using your own tasks or inputs, please use the Task and Input Format Check to help you write your task and input. <n><n>### Note<n>Tasks and input can be pasted

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is someone watching a person who is playing guitar doing? How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The small cabin was not available, so they were upgraded to what? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where would you store a shopping bag if all the seats in your vehicle are full? Choices:  A: the roof B: storage cabinet C: car trunk D: retail store E: home<n><n>### Response:		Store the shopping bag in the trunk.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>Input:<n>The car trunk would be the best place to store the shopping bag if all seats in the vehicle are full because it is located on the back of the car.<n><n>### Input Two:<n><n>Input:Maria left for the airport to travel for her grandmother's birthday. She will be on a 7hour journey. It costs $12 for every one hour of renting a vehicle. At exactly at the time of the trip, Maria rented a vehicle for $360. At what time did she rent it?<n><n>### Output One:<n><n>The vehicle was rented at 10am because it was about 6 hour earlier from the time of departure (7 hours). The rental cost should be $12 because Maria rented the vehicle for 1hours.<n><n>### Response One<n><n>Input:<n>Rent a car at 10 am.<n><n>There will be a 7-hour journey so Maria needs to pay a charge of $12 for every hour of renting a car. The vehicle will be needed for 7hours meaning the charge will be $84 since the bill of 7hours will be calculated as $12*7. The cost is $84.<n><n><n>## Challenge<n><n>This task involves using logical thinking, making a decision, and/or using problem-solving skills/knowledge. <n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: John is going to the gym for his exercise routine. Choices:  A: library B: demonstration C: corner D: football ground E: rug<n><n>### Response:		<n>There could be any number of possibilities for the table to be in the house. However, for the table to be used properly, it needs to be in a space that is conducive for reading or doing homework. If the table is in the library, it will be taken up by shelves and books, or the couch if the library doubles as a living room. If the table is used in the living room, the rug may get in the way. In the corner of the house, the table could be blocked by the television and its accompanying furniture. Finally, the table would never be fit to be put in the football ground. It would be a waste of precious ground and a complete embarrassment to the members.<n><n>### Input:[B] Write another sentence that is a request to use the table to put a flower vase.<n><n>### Response:[B] If I had to use the table to hold a flower vase, the answer would be the living room. A flower vase will hold flowers. Flowers need sunlight and a place to be aesthetically pleasing, and a table can be placed in the living room to accommodate those needs. Furthermore, flowers don’t need to be in the corner, for it will block a clear path that can go into the dining zone. The flowers also don’t necessarily have to be in the hallway, for it can be blocking the door from the house. Therefore, the living room would be able to accommodate the needs for both the table and the flower vase.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Because a circle with radius 3 meters has its center a 3 meters away from the midpoint of any arc.<n><n>## Instructional Note:<n><n>### Instructions:Choose the option that correctly describes the given set of real numbers in the provided diagram.<n><n>### Option A: <n><n>### Option B:<n><n>### Option D:<n><n>### Input (5) Write an expression that represents the area of a triangular region having the given coordinates and a side length of 11 yards.<n><n>y = 7<n><n>x = -5<n><n>x + 7 = 11<n><n>### Solution<n><n>A = 11^2 + (−5 + 7)^2<n><n>A = 41 + 28<n><n>A = 69<n><n>### Instructin:Write three examples of ways in which a coordinate plane might provide an approximation of something.<n><n>Example 1:<n>The circumference of a circle can be approximated if we divide the amount of the number of π.<n><n>Example 2:<n>The amount of a triangular area can be approximated if you divide the area by half of the triangle's side.<n><n>Example 3:<n>The area of a parallelogram can be approximated by dividing a parallelogram's base and height by 2 and multiplying  by the square of the two numbers.<n>                                                   <n><n>### Input x = 3; y = 7; Expand upon the following expression to determine if it is true or false? He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A yard is made up of what? Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n><n>### Response:		 A<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If I wanted to thank someone for saying I have done a good job, what would I do? Choices:  A: smile B: shake hands C: express gratitude D: say you're welcome E: appreciate compliment<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:(A) Samantha has a 3 pound dog named Baxter. (A) The second statement is A fact. (B) The third statement is A claim. (C) The fourth statement is A definition. (D) The fifth statement is A rule.<n><n>### Response:(C)The following definitions may or may not apply to this situation.<n><n>A: The third definition is A term that cannot be defined.<n><n>B: The fourth definition is A general statement about a class of objects.<n><n>C: The first definition is An action that is impossible to perform.<n><n>D: The fifth definition is An action with a specific set of rules.<n><n>### Input:[2013-03-22] Ms. Shannon has 448 students, of whom 182 are in first grade, 170 are in second grade, and 76 are in third grade. How many students does Ms. Shannon’s school have?<n><n>### Response:[The students in Ms. Shannon's school]<n><n>### Input:'How many pears do you have, John?' asked the customer. 'Let’s see...' John thought for a while and replied, 'Okay then. I have three pears.'<n><n>### Response:'John has: 150  or  350    or  210 '<n><n>## Solution<n><n>---
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where can you learn about operations with numbers? Choices:  A: math book B: phonebook C: statistic D: music school E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n>C in order to learn how to add and subtract.<n><n>### Input & Response:<n>B in order to learn how you can get directions.<n><n>###Input:What are the best ways to learn numbers? Choices: A: Addition B: Subtraction C: Multiplication D: Division E: Other<n><n>###Response:<n>All the answers are correct.<n><n>###Assignment:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Output:<n>A.<n><n>### Outputs:<n>B.<n><n>### Direction:<n><n>### Directions to the answer:<n><n>###Assignments:<n>1. What do you notice and wonder?<n>2. How does a number line help us with our understanding of integers?<n><n>### Inputs:<n>B in order for me to learn how to add.<n>1.  I will notice and wonder about the questions.<n>2.  I can get from one point to another.<n><n>###Response to assignment:<n>1. I will notice and have a general overview of how integer operations work.<n>2.  The number line is like reading and writing. Every number can be labeled.<n><n>###How will/does your understanding of number operations help with answering questions?<n><n>###Outputs to assignment:<n>1: I will understand the operations.<n><n>###Directions to output:<n>I can use it to make an output.<n><n>### How does an understanding of number operations help you solve math problems?<n><n>###Instructions to output:<n>1. I can use it to learn the operations.<n>2. I can use it on the operations.<n><n>

If two pigsty's are torn off to make pig and hen and one henhouse is removed to make a pigsty, how many hens are used to make pig and horse?<n><n>### Respuesta<n><n>**4**<n><n>### Instructin <n><n>A store has 5 new toy balls, 3 new green balls, and two new red balls. If two of the green balls are placed one to one another, how many green balls remains to place into the new red ball?<n><n>###  Respuesta <n><n>3<n><n>### Instrutcines<n>-In a store there are 7 red buttons,6 white buttons, and 5 purple buttons. If 4 white buttons are moved so that 1 white button is on top of 3 purple buttons and the one white button on the bottom is on top of 2 red buttons, how many are moved?<n><n>###Respuesta<n><n>**6**

When completing a task, always make note of what you need and why you are making the request. Make sure to always describe WHY you are answering the question in the first place. If you don't do this, you won't be helping people understand what they are going to need to do to answer the question.<n>

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The children saw superman fly overhead, what did they exclaim as a result? Choices:  A: ouch B: skip C: enjoyed D: awesome E: watch television<n><n>### Response:		<n>> The children said 'Enjoyed' as a result because they did enjoy it, skipping and watching television will not necessarily enjoy it.<n><n>### Input and response<n><n>### Input<n>- What time did the plane arrive?<n><n>### Response<n><n>--- You are getting close, let me explain you the answer to this question... Choices:  A: determination B: upper hand C: superior D: higher position E: skill<n><n>### Response:		I would say that the choice A. determinations puts me in superior position as compared to the others.<n><n>If I am able to make the right choice at the right time the choice would lead me into taking the lead and winning the game.<n><n>### Input :  A team has 15 members. I will be the team leader and I get to select 10 members only for the game. I give my team each one minute to decide on the game. How many other teams are there only with 8 team members?<n><n>### Solution:<n>If the team has 15 players and the leader gets to select 10 players only, then there will be 5 other teams that have 8 players each.<n><n>### Question  : 25 people are part of a project and they are working together on it. Out of these 25 people, I select two of them to manage the project. I would like to ask each member of my team only two minutes to complete the project and I would also select two people to assist me in the process. How many minutes will I spend choosing 2 people to team up with me?<n><n>### Answer :<n>If we consider the time available to complete the project in which total 25 minutes would be required then 12 minutes will be allotted for 25/5. That would be 2 minutes (2/25) to be spent in selecting 2 people to team with me.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:People always talked childlike to him, even though his disability was physical and didn't affect his what? Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n><n>### Response:		The answer is option A.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The swimming pool couln't be refilled due to drought regulations, where was it located? Choices:  A: ymca B: california C: park D: first floor E: school<n><n>### Response:		It is on the first floor.

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Your team has 4 people on the line, your opponent has 1 person on the line. Your team runs a play and scores a touchdown. Which of the following would you want more?<n><n>- A) to win by 2 points<n>- B) to win by 4 points<n>- C) to win by 6 points<n>- D) to end the game<n><n><n>### Answer:<n><n>C D<n><n><n>### Question2:<n><n>A man is crossing the road when he is hit by a car. How was he at when the accident happen?<n><n>- A. Driving<n>- B. Walking<n>- C. Eating<n>- D. Biking<n><n>### Answer :<n><n>B<n><n>### Question3:<n><n>The girl from the past has just gone outside to play tag, and you're tagged. Now you both are running away from the tagger. Aside from the tagger, what other people can you choose to be your tag?<n><n>- A.) The tagger.<n>- B.) Other siblings of the tagger.<n>- C.) Friend<n>- D.) Family<n><n>### Answer<n><n>B<n><n><n><n>---<n><n>#### Note: The answer above is a manual, you can refer to it. But please make sure you use the formula and calculations.

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library.
