How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What might a satisfied person do? Choices:  A: board ship B: grocery shop C: cross street D: feel happy E: shout at<n><n>### Response:		<n>**E**<n><n><n># Input:Answer this math problem: Which of the following is the difference of a value? <n><n>### Input(2): <n><n>If the difference of a value is 50, which of these can apply to the value? Choices: 1: a number greater than 0 2: a number greater than -50 3: a number less than 50 <n>4: a number less than -50 <n><n>### Response(2): <n>1 <n><n>### Instructions: The following question is a reading item.<n><n>### Reading:<n><n>A.	How did the ketchup bottle know when it was full?<n><n>B.	"Stop! I got it!" cried Michael. "But I don't understand what I got," complained Jill.<n><n>C. It worked. Michael had fixed it.<n><n>D. This question was for you to answer. Write an appropriate answer.<n><n>### Response (2):<n>D. <n><n>### Explanation: <n>The instructions given for the question is "What did each of the following stories contain?" The story includes a reading example that follows two children who wanted to add ketchup to the meal. <n><n>## Instructions:The following question is a reading story.<n><n>### Story:<n><n>A. My family was always hungry.<n><n>B. In a while my father came to the door holding the last baked chicken.<n><n>C. "It is all right," I said.<n><n>D. My sister took my bun and I took her bone.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>## Response: <n>D. <n>## Explanation:  Reading includes one or more stories which is given in the reading item with three choices. The story reads about a boy eating a bone which he got from a meal.

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:When you experience boredom, what can you do on television? Choices:  A: watch film B: play cards C: play chess D: read news papers E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		A<n>

They look up to see a dog in a nearby yard walking around.  Tapanga shouts to the dog, and the dog turns around to look at them as the dog is going.  How far does the dog have to walk away from these girls so that they can just see the dog's tail?<n><n>### Response<n>### Input:The dog has to walk away for 10 metres in order for the girls to just see the dog'  tail.  Since the dog is turning around just before the girls see its tail, the girls can just see the tail for 5 metres, meaning they need to move away from where they are until they can see that the dog has walked away for 5 metres before they can just see its tail.<n><n>### Demo:The dog has to be about 7.5 metres away from them.<n><n><n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Rumors of roving bands of monsters killing people could lead to what? Choices:  A: panic B: getting in trouble C: mass hysteria D: go to prison E: murder<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:Write the word(s) or phase(s) that best completes the instruction. Be sure to use correct capitalization, punctuation, and other formatting.<n><n>### Response for Q. 1:29<n><n>### Response Explanation:29<n>Because Tapanga has 17 more candies than Core<n> <n>### Response for question 2:10<n><n>### Response explanation:10<n>5 cents a minute * 45 minutes = $ 2.25; 25 cents ** 31 minutes = $7.75 ; total would be = 7.75 + 2.25 = $10<n> <n>### Note<n>This is the first code that i am writing myself, so be gentle, thanks.<n><n>### Comments:<n>- Thank You
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What happens when people are waiting for something? Choices:  A: read book B: getting bored C: worry D: singing E: s never comes<n><n>### Response:		 B<n><n>### Input-<n><n>  |  A |B|C|D|E|<n>  | :--: | ---: | ---: |:--: | ---: |<n>  | 3 |  1|  2| 1|  2|<n><n>### Solution:<n>3<n><n>### Rationale-<n><n>### Input<n><n>| A |B|C |D|E |<n> |----:|----:|---|:|---|<n> | 8 | 1 | 2 | 9 | 2 |<n><n>### Solution<n><n>8<n><n>### Rational-<n><n>### Question:What number does a number 9 add to when added to it self?<n><n>### Choices:<n> | B|C|D|<n> |----:|--:|----:|<n> | A |B|C<n> | 1 |2 |8<n><n>### Answer<n><n>A

Click the "Run Code" button to run your solution and compare it to the answers below.<n><n><n><n>    def get_daily_time_in_minutes(name, start_time):<n><n>        def getDailyTimeInMinutes(name,start_time):<n>          today = start_time + datetime.timedelta(days=1)<n>          return (today - start_time).seconds // 60<n><n>        # Your solution here<n><n>            return getDailyTimeInMenis(name,str(start_time))<n><n>        print(getDailyTime(name,str(day1)))<n>        print(get_daily_time(name, str(day2)))<n><n>    def getDailyTime(name):<n>        start_time = start_time.time() = str(start_time.time())<n>        today = datetime.strftime(end, "%d-%m-%Y")<n>        return today()<n><n>## Part Two<n><n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>The list below contains 9 questions in the same format as question 1. Choices: A: Hamburger B: Pizza C: Banana D: Pumpkin E: Popcorn<n><n>### Response<n>D; Pumpkin.<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>A: Hamburger<n>B: Pizza<n>C: Banana<n>D: Pumpkin<n>E: Popcorn<n>A: Hamburger is the best sandwich of the above choices; it is very low calorie; it’s not too oily.<n>B: Pizza is very high on the calorie scale because of the oily sauce and high amounts of cheese.<n>C: Banana is very high on the fiber scale but also very high on the calories scale.<n>D: Pumpkins are very high on the fiberry scale but also high on the calorie and fat scale.<n>E: Popcorm has high fiber and low calories.<n><n>### Input <n>Is ice cream or fruit sorbet healthier? Choices: A B: C D: E:<n><n>### Response <n>B; D; E.<n><n>### Answer Explanation:<n>All 3 are healthy however ice cream has more calories than the other 2 choices because it is more oily and also has more carbs that are not beneficial to the body.<n><n>### A box of cereal has 40 cups in it. What happens, mathematically, if you take four cups as an example of the cereal? Choices: A : B : C : D : D<n><n>### Response A; B; C ; D<n><n>### Answer: The cereal in the 4 cups is equivalent to the two cups and the fourth cup of cereal. The second cup is half the amount of the third cup and the fourth is twice as much as the fifth cup. The cereal in two cups is equivocal to the one cup of cereal, as well as having two cups of cereal.<n><n>### What is more useful for you, a cup or a liter? Choices:

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:We want to try some new barbecue sauces, where should we buy some? Choices:  A: detroit B: australia C: michigan park D: cafe E: retail store<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Complete this activity that compares two types of mathematical models<n><n>### Demos:<n>Compare algebraic models and coordinate plane models.<n><n>### Input<n>- There are 3 bags with 3 toy cars in each: car A in bag 1, car B in bag 2, and car C in bag 3.<n>- You take out a toy car from each bag using the number of the bag. When you take car A in bag 2, you will take car D in bag 3. Therefore, you take the first 2 cars from bag 2 and the first 3 cars from bag 3 to get 5 cars in total.<n>- Using the algebraic model of bags, write an expression that describes the number of cars you get using a code. Use x to represent the bags and y to represent the number of cars. Write the code for each of the algebraic models for finding the number of cars. The expression in the Algebraic model is 3b x 3y<n><n>### Output<n>- Use the Coordinate Plane model to represent the bags of cars.<n>- When x = 2, y = 1, you get car A. When x = 3, y = 2, you get car B. When x = 2 and y = 2, the 2 toy cars in bag 2 (y) have a total of 3 (x). When x = 3 and y = 1, the 3 toy cars (x) from bag 3 have a total of 4. When x = 1 y = 2, car C from bag y are totalled.<n>

The symbol "?" in the input expression signifies a placeholders. The placeholders in the input expression are used to substitute or fill in the answer. <n><n>### Example 1.<n>The output answer to A has 2199 which is 9 x 242 (The input is 242 x 9).<n><n>### Example2.<n>The output answer for B is 375 which is the sum of 94 + 94 + 181. <n><n>## Additional Input:<n>There is a new place in town that sell a delicious grilled hot dog.<n><n>### Input A. How much meat does the store sell for $1.69 per pound?<n><n>### Input B. Samantha has 3 friends that like to eat hot dogs. She buys 4 hot dogs and splits them equally among her friends. Her friends do the same. How many hotdogs do they enjoy?<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input - Output Interpretation <n><n>### Explanations<n><n>### Example<n>There are 2 inputs A and B. The answers to the different problems will be written beside the inputs for the corresponding problem. For example, under the heading Input A, and there is 44 beside the 1st question. This explains that there are 44 ounces of meat in the package for $1.64.<n>

If you were asked to run to get a first-aid kit and an ambulance, which order would you go in?<n><n>Answer : A<n><n>## Hide And Skip<n>The rules:<n><n>Ask a question - e.g. "Where did the car go?"<n><n>The person on the left hides something. E.g. "I hid my shoe, where did it go?"<n>The person on the right skips. E.g. If I choose to skip, they'll skip the question and repeat it.<n>The person on the bottom can reveal the hidden object, or they can repeat the question.<n><n>You can then move to the left if you can guess what the item is.<n>The person to the left can hide something to challenge the question.<n>Continue until you can't find it.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What type of person typically contracts illness? Choices:  A: hospital B: head C: sick person D: elderly person E: doctor's office<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question.<n><n>## Instructions: Answer the following question.<n>  Select the best answer based on the given context.<n><n>#### Example:<n>A: My school band is good!<n><n>B: Really? Why? How do you know?<n><n>C: Huh? How do I know? Why would you want to know?<n><n>A: I can tell this. How do you know if you can't know?<n><n>### Instrument:<n>### Select the best answer that fits the context.<n><n>> Select the best answer.<n><n>### Example input:<n><n>#### 5. Select the shortest word that will improve the statement <n>"If a bear walks alone, it may have no problem."<n><n>#### Example input:<n><n>If a bear walks ___________, it may have no ___________.<n><n>A. with, problems<n><n>B. alone, problems<n><n>C. alone, problem<n><n>D. with, problem<n><n>> Select the shortest word to complete the statement.<n><n>#### Example input<n><n>If a bear ___________, it __________.<n><n>A. walks alone, hasn't problem<n><n>B. walks alone, has problem<n><n>C. walks with, doesn't have problems<n><n>D. walks with, has a problem<n><n><n><n>### Challenge<n><n>#### 5<n>Complete these sentences correctly.<n><n>A. But this year, the fifth graders were acting really naughty and the teacher was having trouble teaching in that environment.<n>So, the teacher called for an emergency assembly. She told the students she was quitting and going to Miss Viola Swamp's class. Miss Viola told the students they were free to do whatever they wanted to, but she was sure they could do it better. Miss Viola said this and left the classroom. That's when the students started shouting out suggestions.<n>Finally, the students agreed on doing all the things that Miss Viola hated. They watched TV without permission, listened to rock music, and talked while the teacher was talking. The students also drank soda and ate fast food in class!<n>That night after dinner, Miss Viola went to the classroom. She was shocked at what she saw! The TV was on and they were all eating chips and watching the latest video. The class was making noise. Miss Viola couldn't believe her eyes! She asked the students for suggestions, but the students were reluctant to give the teacher advice. Miss Viola asked the students which option would they prefer her to choose. One student suggested that her option should be "both". The student explained by saying:

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Jame's bare feet were burned as he walked, because the sunshine had made the surface hot.  Where might he have been? Choices:  A: disneyland B: snow C: windowsill D: street E: summer<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions<n><div><p>Write a response in the input area below that appropriately completes this multiple choice question. When you are finished, press the "Check Answer" button to check your answers.</p></div><n><n><ol><n><li>A. If the sunshine were on the street, it might have melted some ice on the street surface.</li><n><li>B. If there were snow that burned his feet, he must have been walking in the northern region of our Earth.</li><n><ul><li>C. If he were walking on the windowsill, it would hurt to walk on the sharp edges and glass.</li><n><div><div>D. If he were walking in Disneyland, he would have suffered frost bite.</div></div><n><li>E. If he was walking in the sunshine, his feet would have been toasty hot.</li><n></ul><n><n><n>```php<n><?php<n>    $mixed = array('toto',"tata",array("banana","apple")); <n>    $myarray = ['to',"tata","banana","apple"];<n><n>    var_dump(in_array('banana','tata'));<n>;<n>?><n> ```<n><n> </ol><n><n></div><n><n><div id="comments"><span id="results"></span><a href="#comments">View all the comments</a> </div><n><script src="https://assets.stackoverflownetwork.com/question-comments-widget/js/question-comments-embed.js"></script><div class="q-comments"><a href="#" class="close" title="close comments"><b>&times;</b></a><a class="toc"><b>Table of Contents</b></a></div>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The man was eating lunch, but rushed when he looked at his watch, why did he rush? Choices:  A: gain weight B: late for work C: heartburn D: bad breath E: early for work<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think it was because of [he]  was late for work or he was already late.<n><n>### Explanation: In the question, it says "he" which gives the clues that"he"  was male. It gave "weight". So, the answer is<n><n>> late for work or I am already late.<n><n>Note: there are multiple ways to phrase the answer. This is how I answered. There could be other ways to phrase.<n><n>

She continued to do what? Choices:  A: gain weight B: augment C: dispare D: make larger E: expand<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n><n>### Input : Tapanga and Corei have 66 candis together. However, Tapkanga has 8 more candas than corei. How many candas does corei have?<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Input 1 : What is the length of the line segment 2?<n><n>### Instractions: What is the length of this segment?<n><n>### Response 7: 4<n><n>### Note : If i want to add value 12 to 2 and ask the length of the line 3? Please answer is 28<n><n>### Input2 : What is the length for the segment?<n><n>### Input3 : What is the length to the segment?<n><n><n>### Demo :<n><n>### Input4: What will be the length of this segment?<n><n>```<n>[0:3]<n>   1   2  3  4 <n>   7   9  11 13<n>   1  4  7  1<n>[1:4]<n>[0:4:1]<n><n>Output 1 : 5<n><n>Output 2 : 9<n>output 3: 7<n>output 4: 4<n>```<n><n>### Demo 2 :<n><n>```<n>[1:2:4:2:4:3]<n>   3     7  14<n>[1:2]<n>   1  2  3  4  5<n>   6  7  8<n>[2]<n><n>Output 3: 76<n>```<n><n>## Contributing<n><n>1. [Fork this repo](https://github.com/mandm228/DataFundamentals/fork)<n>1. Clone it <n>1. Create a branch (git branch)<n>1. Add your changes and push(git push origin master)<n>1. Create a [Pull Request](https://github.come/mandm298/DataFundementals/pulls)<n><n><n>* For Questions, Feature or Bug reports please post a [GitHub Issue](https://github.compare/mandm2u8/DataFundamenteuls/issues)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:John and James spent most of their time communicating with each other on their project.  The time required to communicate slowed their what? Choices:  A: static B: train of thought. C: progress D: transfer of information E: collaboration<n><n>### Response:		The answer A stands for static.<n><n><n><n>#

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:She loved buying products, she was driven by her what to shop more than any practical needs? Choices:  A: desire B: money C: time D: credit E: spending money<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In the instructions there were three types of questions. In each question it would state "Input: __________ " and then the question would follow, "How many _____?" I've answered the question above. So I have answered the first two types of questions: "Input: __________" and then the question. In the third type of question the word "Input" was missing, and there wasn't an answer for. So I had to create an answer for that question.<n><n>## The answer is:<n><n>1. A. Desire<n>2. B. Money<n>3. C. Time<n>4. D. Credit<n>5. A. Desire

[B]The mosque of [Petra]. [C]The Jewish community, [Jerusalem<n>][D]The [Jewish community][D]. [E]Temple Mount, [Jerusalem]<n><n>### Second Line<n>[B]The City Hall, [Jerusalem].<n><n>### Second Sentence<n>The city of [Cairo] has the [F]Tahrir Square.<n><n>### The following sentences illustrate one way to complete the sample sentence structure.<n><n>### A)<n><n>### The temple at Jerusalem was founded by [Greek architects]<n><n>### The mosque of Petra is carved into the mountainside near the [River Jordan].<n><n>### C)<n><n>### Jerusalem, a city in the [Middle East], contains the temple at Jerusalem.<n>

Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Choices:  A: insect repellent B: heart attacks C: improved health D: shin splints E: being tired<n><n>### Response:		<n>D: Heart Attacks<n><n>### **Instruction:Answer the following essay question.<n><n>## Write an essay where you describe the differences between the following:<n><n>1. The 1970 Ford Mustang and the 2010 Ford Mustang. The 1990's and the 2000's <n><n>2. A 20 meter ruler and a meter stick. The 2000 dollar bill and a 20 dollar bill.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The 1970 ford mustang is a two door classic pony car,that was designed in a long hood-short deck style and was made by the ford motor company. It is also the first generation ford mustang model.<n><n>The 2010 ford mustang is also a two door classic poney car, that was designed in a long pony car styling. It is also a new generation ford mustang model and was made by the Ford Motor Company.<n><n>The key differences between the Ford Mustang's:<n>In the 1970's, the ford mustang was a front engine with a front-wheel drive, but in the 201h's the ford mustang is a front-engine/ rear-wheel drive design.<n>The Ford Mustang's in the 197'0's had a 79 hp engine and a 4-speed standard drivetrain, while 2010 mustang's had a 305 hp engine and a standard electronic six-speed transmission.<n>The 2000 s ford mustang was a bit heavier than the 1977 model ford mustang with a mass of approximatley 2459lbs, while the 1979 ford mustang was a lite weight model that weighed less than the 201s ford mustang, with a mass of approximatley 2,967 lbs.<n>The 2300 dollar ford mustang cash, was a two door coupe, while the 20 dollar cash bill was a four door bill with a picture of boston massacre, on the back of it, which is the american constitution.<n><n>### The 1978

She noted that the author made some factual errors. Write a response that correctly summarizes the article.<n><n>### Answers:The article was about the current state of the unemployment crisis in the United States. While the unemployment crisis has been growing, the article stated that the current unemployment rate is only 11.7 percent and this will soon go down. However, these numbers do not tell the whole truth. One has to consider the underemployed and those whose wages have dropped from being laid off from work. The article said that these statistics have been fudged by politicians into a favorable view in order for their reputations to remain intact.<n><n>---<n><n><n>### Instruption:<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>---<n><n>

Choices:  A: break easily B: shattering C: melt D: bend E: hold water<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* If a characteristic is A or C, then the glass does not hold water.<n>* If a characteristic does not hold water, then the glass doesn't hold water.<n>* This leaves us with choices B and E.<n><n>Thin glass that is B, shattering, is the correct response. Shattering occurs when a glass breaks into several sharp pieces that are difficult to collect cleanly.<n><n>### Input : Write a sentence that completes the request. Each request requires a sentence that includes a noun, two verbs, and an object that completes the request, as provided.<n><n>### Response :<n>To get a cup of drinking water, we fill water from a pitcher to a glass. When filling water, we pour from the pitcher into the glass because water flows through a strainer or filter into pitcher.<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>* The noun cannot be a proper noun.<n>* The verb cannot be the same as the noun.<n>* There must be an object in the noun phrase.<n>* The object and verb must be separated with one or more prepositions.<n>* The verbs in the final sentence must be the same.<n>* The last sentence should be one complete sentence.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:How might a person address someone who is leaving? Cost to use<n>* 2 - Features of the platform<n><n>### Input:-<n><n>What are the benefits of a good learning management system?<n>- I don't want to have issues with the system and it gets in the way of my teaching<n>- I don'y want the system to crash<n>- I don' wan't to have to deal with bad issues with the system<n><n>#### Response: <n>* Having a secure platform to deliver learning<n>* Being able to quickly find documents and videos <n>* Able to interact with students about learning <n>* Track how much a student is engaged in the subject <n>* The ability to have a community with class discussions<n><n>### Input=[(list a few things the teacher has experienced during their time working with this LMS?)] <n>- Teachers and students can share videos, pictures, and documents<n><n>- Good ability to allow the student to access videos and documents <n><n>- Students can submit assignments with the platform<n><n>- Good ability for instructor to communicate with all the students in the class<n><n>- Teachers can easily share documents online<n><n>- The platform is able to send automated messages to students<n><n>- The platform allows for the teachers to share information, pictures, etc<n><n>- Teach students with video lectures<n><n><n>#### Teach students with video <n>- Videos of yourself explaining the subject<n><n>- Videos with visual aids<n><n>- Videos with multiple choice questions <n><n>- Videos with simulations and practice problems <n>

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If an animal is tired, what is it likely to do? Choices:  A. subject B. predicate C. complement D. modifier<n><n>```<n>Subject <n>Predicate<n>Predicate noun<n>Complement noun adjective<n>Complements noun adjective<n><n>Modifier noun<n>Phrase verbal direct object<n>Phrase noun prepositional phrase (noun + preposition + adjective)<n>Phrase adverbial (verb + preposition + adverb)<n>Phrase nub of a sentence and adjective<n>Subordinate part<n>Phrase n noun to another n noun (Adjective + determiner + noun + prepositional phrase)<n>Phrase (s) adjective + determiners + direct object<n>Phrases adjective + subject<n>Phrase determiner + noun<n>Phrases noun + predicates<n>Phrase adjective + determiner + pronoun<n>Phrase (pronoun + adverb) noun <n>Phrases adverb + adjective<n>Phrase n adjective to n noun + adjective<n>Pronounce the word adverbial<n>Pronounce the phrase adverbially<n><n>Phrases (adj + adjective + adj + adj + adj)<n>Phrases are made up of words that are linked together by <n>Phrase adverbs and adverbs<n>Phrases that link verb with its objects (adj, noun, etc)<n>Phrases of adjectives linking to other adjectives<n>noun + verb + prepositional phrase + subject complement<n>Prepositional phrases that tell the reader more information<n>Noun + adjective + subordinating conjunction + noun<n>Verbal complement of the verb<n><n>Precise of complements<n>Precise subject and object complement<n>Precise adjective and adverb compliments<n>Precise complement<n><n>Subject complement of the preposition<n>Subject complements that are prepositional phrases<n>Subject complements

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		Answer B. The location with the highest potential revenue (150,000 / 240,000,000) is Shopping mall (62). The other answers will not produce the maximum profit.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. To get to the island, they have to climb up 33 stairs. Once there, they run into a cave in which a caveperson has buried 16 treasures. Some of the treasures are buried directly underneath the caveperson; some are buried under piles of dirt; some are buried under a pile of rocks. To find the treasures, the caveperson gives them a 50% chance to find it if it is buried directly under a treasure but only a 2% chance to find it elsewhere.]<n><n>### Response:[To find the treasures, two friends have a 52% chance to find them.]<n><n>### Input[To find the pizza, an employee spends 65% of his time on 4/5 of his task. This means that he spends 78% of his time on one type of his task. He saves 2/5 of the ingredients. How many ingredients were there originally?]<n>![](https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex? \frac{33}{45} \times \frac{45}{100} = \frac{ 24}{25 } \frac{25}{100}\Rightarrow  \frac{24}{25} \approx 25-5 \% \space \space \space \text { Ingredients } \approx 345 \%)<n><n>### Response[: An employee saves 5% of the initial 25%.]<n><n>### In a grocery store, 40% of people are female. Women and men are equally common. For example, this sentence has no capitalization. The first word is "It" and the rest of the word is lowercase. This is important because if we capitalized the word, "It", it would create a better flow. Grammar is important because capitalization helps to make sentences look more organized and clear by separating the word into its parts. The more organized the sentence, the easier it is for people to read it.<n>The example on the previous slide shows how important proper capitalization is to the readability of the material.<n>Grammar is important in society because it makes sentences structurally correct. It ensures that the written material is coherent and readable, which is important in our lives because communication is a fundamental component to everyday life."<n><n>### Response:"Grammar is a very important tool, when being used or taught to children growing up, as it plays a key part in the process of creating coherent sentences. Without knowing how to do it correctly, we wouldn't be able to read and write anything correctly. Grammar also allows us to see how and why certain sentences can be created using nouns pronouns adjectives and adverbs, these components, though small in size, have big effects on the overall meaning and sound of the sentence. So, if someone is unable to create coherent sentences, we wouldn't have anything coherent to read and thus be unable to understand.<n>### Input:Which sentence is punctuated correctly?<n>A. Write a statement that combines all these tests and checks whether M. has passed their class?<n><n>### Response A: Choice: B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>- Use if statements to create the code<n>- If M. passed one test use return to move on to the code for the next test<n><n><n>### Input B: 100 questions are on the math test, and if a student gets 10 wrong questions in math class, then he has failed the math class<n>- If the student misses 2 questions or more in a math test then the student has passed the class<n>- If the students fails the math text or if the student passes the class then the student continues to the next text.<n>- Use if statements as directed above and write a complete program.<n>- When asked for an input the program should use two different questions.<n><n><n>### Response B:<n>- If there are at least 75 questions and if he has more than 10 wrong questions then he fails the class<n>- If he has fewer than 10 wrong answers and he has more than 50 more the correct answer. Choices:  A: use soap B: irritation C: cleanliness D: thinking E: wet towel<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:Enter the values for the first row and then use the formula in the cell to fill down the rest of the table.<n><n>|Cell|<n>|:--|<n>|A1|<n><n>### Instructon:Do you want to see the table?<n><n>### Demostration: <n>|Cell|<n><n>|Answer|<n>|:--|:|<n>|B3|<n><n>### Input and Output: Input <n>Input data: 1 2 3 4 5<n>Output: 3 7 12 15 20<n><n>### Instrumentation:<n>Enter the data in the cells of column B.<n><n>### Response example<n>**Input**<n><n>| B2 |<n>|:--|<n><n>**Output**<n><n>|B5|<n><n><n>Copy the formula from B5 to fill down.<n><n>### Demo explanation:<n>The formula copies from B5, which is the last row of the table.<n>- Then, it pastes in the formula copied in B3 to the empty row after it (1st empty row in the column-the cell address is in B5).<n>- It copies and pastes in cell B4 the formula copied in B2, and so the process is continued.<n><n>### How to do it:<n>Fill in the first row with 1, 2, 3, and so on.<n>Afterwards, you can use the cells with formulas.<n><n>### Input-Output<n>Input: F2 through F6<n>Output 4 8 4 6 4<n><n>### Response<n><n>Copy the formula in F2 to fill down.<n>

He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where is known to always have snow? Choices:  A: africa B: north pole C: roof D: canada E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		Canada<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>Canada has snow all the time.<n><n>### [Instruction](https://github.com/jn0007066/Instructions)<n><n>### Input and Output<n><n><n>### Solution<n><n><n>```python<n>if 1 < a or 1> b:<n>    print("E")<n>else:<n>    print("A")<n><n>```

What part of speech is “write”?<n><n>**Response:** A<n><n>Input:How many 3-digit numbers can you make with the digits 0 - 9?<n><n>**Response**: 999<n><n>Input:I added three 6-digit numbers. I crossed out two parts of each, then divided the result of each set. Now I have 192 divided by 11, and 38 divided by 2, and 76 divided by 7. How am I going to find the number I started with?<n><n>**Response 1:** Multiply the two numbers you subtracted.<n><n>**Response 2:** If you multiply each division by a common number, you’ll get the same answer.<n><n>Input:Which of the following numbers is divisible by 7?<n><n>### Response 1: The number divisible by 7 is 49<n><n>### Response2:The number divisible by 8 is 28<n><n>Input:While baking Christmas cookies there was an oven failure and only one batch survived. All 4 batches were 10 cookies each. What was the number of cookies?<n>### Response 2:<n>All batches were 14 cookies each since there were 4 batches and each batch was 10 cookies. 14 * 4 = 56. 56-40 (the number of cookies made but failed) = 16.<n><n>### Input<n>Which of the following number of letters would not match the given word?<n><n>A-14 letters - mammal B-15 letters – tiger C-16 letters – dog D-17 letters – fox<n><n>**Response: D**<n><n>There are 17 letters in fox.<n><n>### You are the teacher of the third grade class at Caldwell Elementary. Choices:  A: air B: water C: earth D: space shuttle E: tunnel<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If we keep track of how much Earth’s atmosphere there is, it is on Earth’s surface. (Not the Earth’s atmosphere, Earth’s surface.)<n><n>The Earth’s atmosphere is all over the Earth. (The Earth’s atmosphere isn’t all over the Earth. How could all of Earth’s atmosphere be anywhere but Earth's surface?)<n><n>You can’t keep track of how much air there is in the sky. (Yes, you can! Look into your binoculars. You’ll see clouds, birds, planes, balloons, and a whole bunch of air.)<n><n>The Earth's atmosphere doesn't have any ozone. (There isn’t any ozone on Earth’s surface either, only in the ionosphere and stratosphere.)<n><n>No one’s been to space in a long time. (Because only astronauts have been to space, and there is no one on Earth anymore.)<n><n>We already know how much air is in our tunnels. (How come?)<n><n>### Input and Response<n><n>### Input<n>If I have to keep water out, where am I?<n><n>### Response<n><n>You’re in an airlock! (Airlock is air that is contained.) <n><n>When you come out of airlock, it is called Earth. (Earth is made of air.) <n><n>The Earth is everywhere. (Earth is not everywhere. How could Earth be everywhere? It can’t, not even at the center of the Earth!)<n><n>The moon is not water. (The moon is 12% water. So you’re wrong.)<n><n>This container is water tight. (If it wasn’t water tight, water could get out!)<n><n>### Input <n><n>Let’s go to a planetary science museum.<n><n>### Response <n><n>There is no museum of astronomy. All of the planets and moons are on the inside. (Astronomy is outside where the planets and moom are!)<n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>Input: How hard is a whale’s bite?<n><n>Answer:<n><n>3<n><n>Input: How heavy is an ostrich?<n><n>Answer: 115 L

Lastly, she knew that it was not a cow because it was in the room with her and cows can't do that. What animal was Mary looking at?<n><n>### Solution/Answer:-<n>The animal that Mary was looking at was a dog.<n><n>### Input:-<n>Melanie, Brielle, and Caitlyn were in charge of organizing supplies. They each picked a category to organize. Melanie chose scissors and they put them all in one spot. Brielle put all screws together because she thought it would be easier to find them if they were all in one place. Caitlyn picked all clothes-hangers, and the girls put the screws, sunglasses and a whole bunch of other things by them. Who chose where to put things the easiest?<n><n>### Solution<n>Because the answer to the question is Brielle.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Because the answer is: Caitlyn

Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What might someone want to be if he or she is thick? How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. The pig's age in this case is how many days, minutes, and seconds since it was born (i.e. "I been here for 32 days, 19 hours, and 45 minutes"). If it has been the number of days specified by the first argument for that long since the pig was born, return "That's cool!" If it is not as long, return "Nah, I think you're gettin' old."<n><n>```<n>Input: calculatePig(15, 0)<n>Output: "Nah, I know you're gettina' old, lol"<n><n>Input: calculatePigs(4, 7)<n>Output:  "That's cool! you been here for 90 days, 16 hours, and 39 minutes"<n>```<n><n>### Answer:C<n><n>### Demos: Here are some solutions to the problem.<n><n><n>C (pig) -  if days since pig was born >= 30 then print "Nah, I thing you're gett'n old," else print  "That's Cool, I think you've been here for" number days * 24 + 60 + string min(minutes, (days / 7) * 2)<n><n><n>D (dog)-  if days since dog was born > 24 else  "Nah I know your gettina old for sure" <n><n><n>F (fish)-  if days since fish born > 30, else print "" "Nah I think your gett'na bit old"<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Mrs Bairden told her students to say the top and bottom numbers of the rectangle. But the rest of the numbers should be skipped. What is the bottom row of the multiplication table in the rectangle?<n><n>### Note:<n><n>First row: <n><n>1 x 2 = 2<n><n>2 x 3 = 6<n><n>3 x 4 = 12<n><n>4 x 5 = 20<n><n>5 x 6 = 30<n><n>6 x 7 = 42<n><n>Second row: <n><n>7 x 8 = 56<n><n>8 x 9 = 72<n><n>9 x 10 = 90<n><n>Third row: <n><n>8 x 11 = 8

Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What does a person looking for new things in life do? D: A cyclist is more likely to get seriously injured than a car rider in a motorcycle accident. Answer<n><n>C<n><n>### Instructions:After reading the instructions about the task, read the paragraph carefully. Then use the task instructions as your answer.<n><n>### Task instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the questions.<n><n>### Response1. The paragraph below explains why people should wear helmets when riding a bicycle. Explain the main idea.<n>Bike riders die at a high rate on the road compared to motorcycle riders, which means that bicyclers are most in danger of an extreme accident than other road users. A bike helmet, however, can make a big difference in the chances of surviving a crash. A helmet can reduce the risk of brain injuries by 48% and of severe brain injuries by 68%. <n>### After reading the task instructions, respond by writing the main paragraph below. How many apples does each bat eat?<n>What is the minimum possible value?<n><n>### The best Answer to the above question can be:<n><n>Input: 50,12<n>Output:25<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the question which is given as an instruction.<n><n>### Response Format: You can use single line or two lines.<n>### Subscript:<n>Use * to create subscript<n>```<n>input is [4 2 7 6] then the output should be 21<n>```<n><n>```<n>subscript 4 should be $4<n>```<n><n>### Subscript-2:<n>Use! to create subscript<n><n>### Example :<n>```<n>Input is (3-2)-4, Output should be 1.<n>```<n><n>```Rewrite<n>Input is (3!-2!)-4<n>Output is 1<n>```<n><n>##| Input: Write any number (between 1 and 10) that is a multiple of 10. How many digits are there in total?<n>```<n>Input: A16, Output should be 4<n>```<n><n>#| Input: Write any sum that is the product of three or more consecutive digits. What is the smallest of these sums?<n>```<n>Input is 54-34+81<n>```<n><n>#|| Input: Write any number where the two right most digits are the same. How many of these numbers exist?<n>##<n>`Output should be 3`<n>##<n><n>#[20:34-] Write any sum of two or more consecutive digits. Write any sum of two digits where the same digit appears twice in a row. Write any number where two left most digits and two right most digits are zero.<n><n>##Input and Question:<n>```<n>Input is [3 3 3]<n>```<n>##Output is 333<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The color yellow is associated with the opposite of the characteristic, what is it? Choices:  A: fearless B: english carrier C: courageous D: brave E: achromatic<n><n>### Response:		Correct - yellow is associated with courageous.<n><n>### Explanation: Correct - Yellow is associated with courageous because Yellow is associated with the opposite characteristic(dark).<n><n>### Input : There is 30 boxes and each contain 100 cookies. Each box has some cookie missing. Each box have 15 pieces missing. How many pieces of cookies are in the missing boxes?<n><n>### Response :Correct- missing cookies are 450.<n><n>###Explanation : Correct - The equation for this question is: 100+2*15=450<n><n>## Challenge<n><n>#### Instruction<n><n>- Write two expressions. The first expression will contain two expressions and the second expression will contain three expressions.<n><n>#### Response<n><n>```<n>50+30 100%<n>6*8 64%<n>64 * 8 488%<n>50 * 3 150%<n>```<n><n>#### Explanation<n><n>```<n>Each expression equals to what percent of its original number? (the question is: 50+30 and the question asked in challenge).<n><n>50+34=50+30+40=80 so 80%<n><n>64% = 64 ÷ 100<n>64 ÷ 64 = 5%<n>```<n><n>```<n><n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The man needed balls of cotton, where should he look? Choices:  A: south B: georgia C: north carolina D: pocket E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input/Response:<n>Freddy makes $5.35 per hour at his summer job. Write a formula that evaluates to the number of hours Freddy should work based on the rate paid per hour and the amount he would like to earn in total.<n><n>### Input A: I want to earn a total of 120.00$ <n><n>### Input B: Per hour 5.35 <n><n>### Response C:<n>120/$5.35=21.56<n><n>### Input D: I will work 3 hours per day<n><n>### Response B:<n><n>8.4957<n><n>### Output: 8.495<n><n>### Demand:<n>Write a paragraph explaining why you chose Option C.  <n><n>### Demons:<n>Ann is in her second hour of Math and feels very confused. She does not know where to start on her homework. She also does not want to call her mom and ask for help because her mom is busy and is currently giving birth to Ann's baby sister. Ann knows that she has one hour left in math class. Should Ann call her mom to get help?<n><n>### Response D:<n><n>No, I would not recommend Anna to call her mom. Anna is trying to help herself out she should not rely on somebody to do her work for her. However, if her homework is too difficult to do alone she should call her mom.<n><n>### Option C:<n>The correct answer is 18886.3. That is correct because 1888 is the last two digits, 6, of the phone number the user entered and is less than 7, hence the sum of the two answers would be 1888 + 6 – 7 = 18887. When you use subtraction on 6 and 7 you get 1 so you have to add the answer 1888 to the answer you got from multiplying the number by 10 and adding the last two digits. <n><n>### Demos:<n>What if the user didn’t want the sum but rather the two digits that are in the last position of the number the user entered?<n><n>### Input 2751<n><n>### Response 751

Which bag of chips would cost more?<n><n>### Response<n><n>We have to find the smaller price. The price is $1.70. <n><n>### Demos:Bags of chips has a $1.70 price.<n><n>### Response:(B)<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>I have a cupcake (0.27 lb) worth $3,990 (3990 calories) and a jelly doughnut (2.17 lb) worth $200 (2,000 calories). Which type of food has more calories?<n><n>### Responses<n><n>Jelly doughnut has more calories<n><n>### Demons:<n>We have to find which food has more calories. In this case we need to divide the calories which is used in determining which food is bigger and more nutritious.<n><n>### Input(C)<n><n>### Response(D)<n>Which food has more calories than the other?<n><n>### Answers<n><n>A. The doughnut has 5.87 more calories.<n><n>### Question<n>The man sells the fruit for $6 and the apples for $2 but he can sell both for $3. What is the total amount of profits gained by selling one fruit and two apples for $5?<n><n>### Input<n><n>$3 from each items.<n><n>### Responce<n><n>$3 each because each of the items are selling for $5.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>We need to find the total profit gained by selling one apple and two apples. If he sold apples for $2 then he would gain $2 and if he sells the fruit for 6 then he would gain $6 which is the total that he can sell for $5.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Dancing for a long time will lead you to become what? Choices:  A: sore B: intercourse C: fatigue D: become tired E: expression<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Instructor Notes:<n><n>How do you write a task?<n>

The first person wants to know how much money the other three have. Each person has the same amount of money, while the first one has half as much as the second one. The third one has 50 cents more than the second one, and the fourth one has twice as much as the third one. The first one knows that the second one has more than half of his amount, the third one cannot find out what the fourth one's amount is, and no one knows who has more than the fourth one. Find out what each man has in his pocket.<n>> 1st person: (His amount)/2<n>> 2nd person: (His + 50)/2<n>> 3rd person: (His - 50)<n>> 4th person: (Twice his + 60)/2<n><n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>1st person: $150<n>(His amount)/2: $125<n>2nd person: $75 (His + 100)/2: $87.50 (His + 25)/2: $83.75<n>3rd person: $50<n>4th person: $125 (Twice his + $15)/2: $100<n><n>#### Solution:

Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n><n>### Response:		Choice: question<n><n>### Instructions:This question has one correct response and two incorrect responses.<n><n>### Question:What does the letter X stand for in XYZ?<n><n>### Choices: Correct Response: Choice: Z<n><n>### Instructor's Explanation:The correct response is "Z" because XYZ means "abide by the Z."<n><n>### Response Guidelines: Answer with an explanation. Be sure to choose only the correct response.<n><n>### InputA customer wants to exchange a DVD that he just purchased from you for another DVD. If the customer only had one original choice, he should return to the store with what kind of DVD? Choices: A: an old one B: a faulty one C: a refurbished one D: a duplicate one<n><n>### Response Choice: D<n><n>### Instrumental: This question has one correct response.<n><n>**Input:**  Your dad got three packages from Amazon. The first package weighed exactly 5 pounds. The second package had the same weight as the first package, but it was one ounce heavier. The third package weighed 2 pounds more than the second package. How many pounds does the third package weigh?<n><n>**Response:** 12. This is because the first package weighs 5 pounds, the second package weighs x (where x is 1 ounce greater than 5) or 6 pounds, and the third package weighs 1 pound more than the second, or 7 pounds, for a total of 12 pounds.<n><n>### Conversation: This question has one answer.<n><n>**Input**  I got a question from a customer that reads... "Hi, how can I tell if there is any interest in a product that I will be selling?" I don't know if this person is talking about their new CDs or their antique toys....<n><n>### Response<n><n>**Response: **The following response is appropriate:<n><n>**Thanks for the question.** What do you do if a product doesn't sell right away? That's a great question. **I'd recommend checking to see if there are other items in the store that complement what you're selling.** For example, if you have CDs, see if the store
