Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Choice B, Concert<n><n>The microphone boom covers the singer's voice during live music performances. People sing to live audiences to enjoy their favorite songs, which creates excitement and fun.<n><n>### Input:(2x+-3)/(4-5)=?<n><n>### Response:(5x+-3)/-4)<n><n>The answer is the reduced fraction.<n><n>### Comments:<n><n>If you are not familiar how to reduce the fraction, use the shortcut.<n><n>1.) Divide by common denominator<n>2.) Then simplify the answer.<n><n>For this question, 4 and -5 are the common denominator.<n><n>You can also multiply the numerator and the denominator by the common denominator. The answer will be the same.<n><n>### Question:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>How many two digit numbers end in a digit which is the sum of each of its digits? Choices: 1A: all the numbers 2B: 69C: none of the numbers.<n><n>### Response<n><n>Choice C, none of the numbers. We don't know if all 10 digits (0-9) end in a number which is the sum of its digits. We have limited information and so do not understand this question thoroughly. We have limited information to understand this question thoroughly.<n><n>### The Question<n>### Multiple Choice - Answer <n>### Multiple Choices - Input/Response

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. One of the members came back from lunch with their snack bag and noticed that there were 10 fewer Oreo cookies than last time. However, they knew that no one else in the group ate more cookies. At the same time, one of the members noticed that there were 9 5-minute gummy bears in the gumball jar when before there were 15. In addition, the group passed the Oreos around twice but there were still 10 Oreos missing! How many Oreo cookies were there at the start of the convention?<n><n>__Answer__<n><n>There were 14 more gummy bears than cookies.<n><n>There are 9 5- min gummy bears but 10 oreos missing<n><n>Therefore<n> 15+14=30<n><n>There were 30 gumballs<n>

Choices:  A: graph B: bank at noon C: good book D: post office E: bus stop<n><n>### Response:		A:C<n><n>### Instructions:Create a program that asks the user to input 5 numbers from 1-9 then outputs the smallest and second smallest number. If the user input to program does not contain 5 numbers, the program should prompt the user to get to step 2.<n>Use code to do this.<n><n>### Program:<n><n>**main** ()  <n>```  <n>#include<iostream>  <n>  <n>using namespace std;  <n><n>int Main() {  <n>  <n>    int n1 = 0;  <n>    int n2 = 0;   int n3 = 0;   intel n4 = 0;   n5 = 0;   string n6 = 0;   cout << "Enter 5 numbers to find smallest number: ";   cin >> n1;<n>for (int i = 1; i < n1; i++) {  <n>      cout<< endl<<"Enter the next number in the list: ";  <n>      cin >> n2;<n><n>   }   cout<< endl<<"Smallest number is: " << endl;  <n>    for (int i = 2; i < n1-1; i++) {<n>     if (n2 - n1 < n3 - n1) {<n>      n3 =n1;       n4=n1-1;      n5=n2-n1+1;   n6=n1+i;   <n>    }   else {<n>       n3 =n1-1;<n>     }<n>for (int i=2; i<n1-1;i++) {<n>    if (n4 - n1 < n5- n1) {<n>        n5 =n1 - 1;   <n>   }<n>}<n>for (int i<n1-2;i++) {<n>            if (n6 -n1 < n4-n1) {<n>           n4=n5 ; n3=n6 ;  <n>           n2 =n1 -1;  <n>            n1 = n1 + 1;     <n>     <n>}      n6 = n4-2;<n>}<n>    }<n>cout << "The smalles number is :" <<(n3 - n1)<<endl;  <n> cout<< "The second smallest number is :" <<

He hates animal abuse and is careful about the places he enters.  The dog he brought home from the shelter 5 months ago is very ill now.  What should john do? Choices A: take him back to the shelter B: take him to the vet C: eat him D: kill him E: give him medicine<n><n>### Response<n>John should take the dog to the vet because the dog might be suffering from a serious illness from which it needs proper medical attention.<n><n>### Input.<n>1. There are 24 people attending a workshop about the history of New England. The organizers have arranged for 16 hotel rooms. There are more people than rooms.  How many people will share a room? Choices: 1: 3 people 2: 2 people 3: 16 people 4: 8 people 5: 14 people<n><n>### Response.<n>As more people sign up for the workshop than there are rooms, people will share rooms. There are only 16 rooms available. This is why each hotel room will have more than one occupant.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What would you tell ali to do if he bumps into you when you are walking? Choices:  A: work hard B: slow down C: wear shoes D: sell products E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		<n>Tell ali to slow down.<n><n>### Input<n>Derrick had to bring his 2 brothers from the city to camp. They got there at the same time E. 8:00pm<n><n>### Response<n>Derrick's brothers arrived 5 minutes before Derrick.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>I'll have my friends and family members use a calculator to solve some mathematical problems.<n><n>### Incorrect (incorrect response to multiple choice, incorrect response to multiple choice, and incorrect response to multiple choice)<n>1. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Choices: A: 8 B: 7 C: 9 D. 6 E: 5<n><n>### Response Choices: C<n><n>### Input  : The number of people in a family is ten thousand. The number of members is divided into two groups: the smaller group is ten percent of the number of people in the family, while the larger group is 75 percent of the number of members. What is the probability that marble picked are:<n>    A. not green<n>    B. not blue<n>    C. not blue or red<n>  [2*7*8+2*4*5 ] * 4/ *(2*4*5) = 0.95<n>### 3. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Write your response in that sequence.<n><n>### Task: Write a code that will print the words you type. You only have one function called printWord(str) that the main script will use. You can assume that the printWord function takes in a string that is a word that you want the script to print. You will then print the word by replacing every letter with the number position in the alphabet. For example, printing "hello" will print "12345". The word "jumped" will print "13456". The output sequence should be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Note that the letters "I", "J", and "W" are capitalized because of the positions they have in the alphabet. You only need to print a word after I have typed a word. There should be only one prompt telling the user to type a word and it should not prompt again until after I have printed the word.<n><n>### Input (user prompt): Type a word you want to print then press Enter.<n><n>### Expected Output: 1<n><n>### Exercise 3<n><n>Below is a text that describes a programming problem. Write a sequence of commands that prints the answer to this question.<n><n>## Task:<n><n>Your friend has an assignment that requires a program to help get the most out of a new game they are planning on purchasing. There are 5 levels in the game. When you reach a new level you get 20 points. The first level starts at level 1 and the last level starts at level 5. The levels are numbered 1, 255, 386, 387, and 451.<n><n>## Your task:<n><n>Write a program that prints the level name and level number.<n>You can assume that the level you choose is an integer between 1 and 5.<n>If the user chooses a number that is not between 1 and 3 or 4 and 5, your program should print "I am sorry, but that level doesn't exist! Please let me know."

If you purchased the car at its full price of $30,000, how much did the extra features increase in cost?<n><n>### Data:<n>```<n><n>**$3000 discout on the cost of a $300.00 car**<n><n>```<n> <n>### Input:<n>* At the beginning of March, John had a $30 gift card debt on a store. At the beginning of May, he had an additional debt of $50 plus an additional $45 charge for his first credit charge. He did not make a payment in April. If John had an original debt of $55 at the beginning of March, how much money did he still owe at the end of May?<n>* Input: A man uses 1/2 kg of sugar for 5 batches of a cake he is making that comes out to 300 grams. What amount of sugar should he put in each batch of the cake?<n>```<n><n>### Data Input:<n><n>* John has 5 cans of water and 3 gallons of water. He also has 2 cans of water. What is the volume of all the water in John's water supply in gallons?<n><n>```<n>5 cans of water have 16 ounces of water.<n>3 gallon have 128 ounces of water<n>2 cans have 8 ounces of wate, therefor the gallon would then become 248 ounces, therefore the gallon was 100 ounces<n><n>Answer: 378<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately demonstrates the process of multiplication as it is presented in the instruction.<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>## Solution 2:<n><n>### Instructon:<n><n>Write a complete sentence that explains the process of finding the remainder of a division problem.<n><n>Ex. 32 ÷ 4 = 8 r 2<n><n>### Response1<n><n>Remainder when 32 is divided by 4 is 2<n><n>##

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is the result of instituting civil action? How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What happens to people when they do not have enough food? D<n><n><n>1. C<n><n><n>2. Choices:  A: giggle B: lie C: laughing D: chuckle E: smoke<n><n>### Response:		A person laughing<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: The 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall Song<n><n>### Instuctions:Create variables that track what the number of bottles is and how many bottles are drank.<n><n>### Note: The numbers can be whatever you want, you must only change them while implementing.<n><n>### Function to be created:<n>**Example:**<n><n>```python<n>bottle=0<n>while bottle <= 99:<n>    print ("I drink this beer")<n>    bottle = bottle - 1<n>```<n><n>### Instructiions:Create a Main Method with a list of Bottles and a list of Drink method. Your main method should contain your code for creating a main method to your program.<n><n>### Your response is expected to be an appropriate solution <n><n>### Demostration:<n>```python<n>def main_method():<n>    <n>    bottles = [ 0]<n>    drinks = [0]<n>    while bottles[0] > 0:<n>        print ("I drink this bottle")<n>        # bubles = bubles -1<n>        bottles.pop(0)<n>        drinks.append(drinks[0] + 1)<n>    <n>main_method()<n>```<n><n>## Instructions:Create a bottles variable that stores the information you need to do your work. The variable you create will need to change when your program goes through the main method.<n><n><n>* The variable bottles only needs a list of bottles at the beginning<n><n>### Instinctions:create a new variable named drinks.<n><n>* The bottles variable does not have to change when the program is going through the main method<n><n>### Instucions:Create an empty list called bottles.<n><n>### note:Your variable must change when your program goes over your main method. You must change the variable when your program enters the main method.<n>### Democtra:I am going to create an empty list with variables in a list called bottles. This program should be able to loop and count the number of drinks. I also want to pop up a message saying that you drank that amount of bottle

You can fit 1.4 gallons of water in a standard 5 gallon plastic water, so 625 mL/1000 mL= 0.625. Which is 625 / 0.626 = 1000; thus, 1000 x 0.62=620 mL.<n><n>### Differentiate the following two expressions:<n><n>` 6.04 x 1000 * 2000 + 500`<n><n>`6.04 x (1000 x2000 +500) `<n><n>### Response to Input:<n>I think the second equation is correct because the first one has too many parentheses.<n>

Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: happiness D: being entertained E: walk slowly<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a situation when a kid is being taken to play. I agree that choices B and C may be the child's behavior. In my opinion, it doesn't necessarily mean a child is happy. I know how I feel when I'm going to play. I may be happy walking fast with my legs. I may be happy sitting or standing. At other times I may be silent, sad, and angry. At times I am being entertained or just laughing with my friends. But I don't always act in the way expected of me.<n><n>A child can be doing many things while going to play such as talking with friends, walking, and playing a game. They may also play games that take a lot of concentration and require a lot of patience.<n><n>Answer: <n>Because I don't know the answer, I am selecting B to be true<n><n>### Input-A: Write a sentence that explains this picture.<n><n>### Response<n>This picture is telling an old, sad story, a child who's very upset. Because he was sad, the child cried for his mom. A little girl saw him, and had an idea. She went on the computer and sent a message to her mom asking to pick her up from school. The mom replied with a message saying to get her daughter and bring her to the train station. She will be at the train station waiting with a bouquet of flowers and a welcome note.<n><n><n>### Input A: What happened when the children went outside?<n>Select the sentence that answers the question.<n><n>1. The children went inside and ran back into their house.<n> 2. The children ran outside and went around the corner<n>3. The children ran outside after they got their mittens.<n><n>Select the sentence that best answers the above question from the choices above<n><n>Answer: 3 because they got their mittens after running outside<n><n>### Instructions<n>Here is a word group you did with your teacher.<n><n>A. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A person with children might have a lot of plastic things in what place? Choices:  A: cupboard B: cabinet C: own home D: everything E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		A: cupboard<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A bride and groom are taking care of proposals, what is the likely ceremony? Choices:  A: efficiency B: getting work done C: marriage D: finishing up E: results<n><n>### Response:		<n> A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Teacher should not complete above line, below answer is example how teacher should proceed<n><n>### Example:<n>A: efficiency B: getting the work done<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Teacher may ask following questions<n><n><n>### Instructons:<n><n>Please respond to your peers. You may not all work on the same question.<n><n>## Example Response:<n><n>Hey, A or B in this case would be an efficiency because the bride and groom needs to ensure that their wedding is perfect and if the are inefficient, they would not be able to marry, so a perfect solution for them is efficiency, therefore they both get married.<n><n>Happy Learning!!!<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Bill bought an upright piano but didn't have anywhere to put it because he lived where? Choices:  A: band B: music room C: college D: university E: house<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A: band B: band C: band D: music room E: music room<n><n>### Instrucion:<n>Input: Anita goes bowling and spends more than she earns every Friday night. She earns enough money for 3 bowling games plus 7 extra tickets. How many extra tickets can she earn for $5 more?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: David makes $45 per hour working as a lifeguard and $20 bartending. He can only work for a total of 7 hours per day. Given that he works a total of 50 hours per week, how much more money does he make as a lifeguard as opposed to a bartender?<n>Answer: $105<n><n>Input: Ava has 14 pennies, 4 quarters, and 6 dimes. How many pennies does she have?<n>Answer: None<n><n>Input: A class of students have a total of 480 assignments. If each assignment is worth 2 points, and each student gets 1/4 of the point, how many points does the class as a whole gain?<n>Answer: 48<n><n>Input: Tom’s mom works 6 days a week and earns $1 for each shift. He does chores for $0.50 for 525 chores. He also earns $200 for each vacation per year. Tom’s mom and Tom go on a 1 week vacation together each year. What is Tom’s total hourly rate?<n>Answer: Tom is paid $0.82/hour<n><n>Input: The water that was lost in the city was restored in 48 hours. How many hours did the water system take from restoring all of the water?<n>Answer: 0.5<n><n>Input: Kellie has a water bottle that holds 32 ounces of water. How many ounces does she have?<n><n>Choices:  A: 32 ouncers B: 40 ouncers C: 5 gallons E: 64 ouncers<n><n>Answer: E: 64<n><n>Input: Ben has 1/3 as much money as Mike. If Ben has $9,600 and Mike has $36,000

Choices:  A: city centre B: lottery ticket C: maps D: street E: busy city<n><n>### Response:		<n>If I were arriving to a new city, I would find a B: Lottery Ticket that would help me get to the city centre and I might find a C: Map of the city to show me my way in the unfamiliar territory.<n><n>### Input:[A] What part of the city do you live in? B) Do you have a partner? C) If so, what does your partner do for a living? D) Do you like your job? E) Do you have any children? F) What do they do for fun? G) Do you exercise?<n><n>### Response<n><n>I live right in the middle of the city, the best part of it is that I live in an old Victorian home, we're near the zoo so my kids can see all sorts of animals, and my husband is a doctor, he's a surgeon and he really saves lives by operating on people who need organs, so I am really thankful that he has that job. My kids are students, they study hard and work very hard, all of them have jobs, we give them a good life. I am a teacher and I have a doctorate degree, I work in a university. I love my work but I really work so much that I don't have much time for exercise, and my kids and I are going to the beach to swim, and I usually take one of my kids to a bar and we often play a soccer game there.<n><n>### Task: 1. Choices: an action sentence a statement a question a direction<n><n>### My choice: a statement<n><n>### The right answer should be a sentence that is a question.<n><n>## Question: You had an appointment to meet at 3:00 PM. Was I there on time?<n><n>### The next question is also a statement.<n><n>Q: Did you have enough time to do your homework?<n><n>### Last question is also a statement:<n><n>Q: When will we finish eating so we can go to school?

Each step should include instructions, code, and explanations.<n><n>## Instructions:Write a line of code, step-by-step, that will find the number of days in a month by calling the function days_in_month.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>```<n>from datetime import date<n>def get_month_days():<n>  today = date.today() <n>  month = today.month <n>  return (32 -month)<n><n>print(days_in_month())<n>```<n><n>## Challenge: Write a step-by-line implementation of a function that has the signature def find_the_difference(string1, string2).<n><n>### Challenge Instructions:<n>Write a line of line implementation of a function that takes to strings as an input and find the difference between two strings.<n><n># How I Implemented Find The Difference <n><n>```<n>def find_the_differnece(string1, string 2):<n>    output = sum(cfor c in string1 if c not in string2)<n>return output<n><n>```<n># Challenge<n>```<n>In the below case input, what is the output?<n><n># Input<n><n>b = 10<n>a = 0<n><n># Output<n><n><n>'''a=5b='bbb'<n>```<n>b.find the difference with 4<n>The difference is<n>````<n>12 - 4 ````<n><n>## How to Improve<n><n>1. Understanding of find_the_different<n>2. Writing simple and clear instructions that will help user understand the task.<n>3. Using comments<n>## How to Fix the Problems<n><n>1. Understand function syntax.<n>2. Improve code syntax

Choices:  A: run B: swimming C: calculate things quickly D: fight enemy E: urinate<n><n>### Response:		I've never heard that one so I am going with A, though none of the options appear to make much sense.<n><n>### Input and Response:Explain why the following sentences are correct or incorrect based on the highlighted words.<n><n>> When a friend asked, "How many apples do you have?" I said, "I have two apples. All my apples are red. Some apples are rotten." This sentence is Correct.<n><n>### Why:<n>I have two apples is the correct answer to the question. All my apples is redundant given the question. The rest of the sentence is irrelevant.<n><n>> Tiger Woods took four putts and missed each putt. This sentence is Incorrect.<n><n>> Troy and Evan split 10 candy bars. They shared 1⁄2 of the candy bars between Troy and Evan. This sentence is Correct. <n><n>### Why<n>Troy and Evan split the 10 candy bar equally and received 5 candy bars each. The split was also equal.<n><n>### Comments on the following Sentence:We were given an assignment to make a report for a contest. In 10 minutes, we had to give our presentation in front of the class.<n><n>  > I would say I did a decent job on it.<n><n>The sentence is not grammatically incorrect or missing punctuation, but I would not say I did a decent report. If I was to give this report again, I would change it so that it was more accurate.

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Dan outfitted his house to run on the oldest heat source on Earth. What is the oldest heat source on Earth? Choices:  A: fire B: solar energy C: sun D: house E: coal or wood<n><n>### Response:		<n>```javascript<n>function oldestHeatSource(n) {<n>    switch(n){<n>        case 'fire': return 'fire'<n>        case'solar': return'solar energy'<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input<n><n>```javascript<n>function isCorrect(s,t){<n>    // your code goes here   <n><n>    s = (s!= 0 && s!== undefined)? s : "0"<n>    t = (t!= 0 && t!== undefined)? t : "0"<n>    <n>    let op = "+"<n>    if(t > s){<n>        op = "-"<n>    }<n>    let output = s + op + t<n>    //console.log(output)<n>    if(output!= 0){<n>        return true<n>    }<n>    return false;<n>}<n><n>```<n>

If the input date string `s`is "01/01/0012" it will return `true`. If in `s` is "2012/01/01" it will return `false`.<n><n>Input: isGoodDate("2015/09/29") returns 'false'<n><n>Input: is GoodDate("12/02/2100") returns 'true'<n><n>### Instructions:Write recursive code.<n>### Demonstion:<n><n>```javascript<n>function isGoodDate(s) {<n>   if (s =="" || s == " ") return false;<n>   const DATE= s.split(/\s+/);<n>   for (let i = DATE.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {<n>       if (i>= 0 && i < 4) {<n>           if ((new Date()).getUTCFullYear().toString < DATE[i]) return false;<n>          if ((new Date().getUTCFullYear()).toString == DATE[i]) {<n>              if (DATE[i+1] == "-") return true;<n>              if (i!= 3) {<n>                  if ((new Date ).getUTCMonth().toString() > +1 + +8 - parseInt(DATE[i]) ) return false;<n>                  if (( new Date().getUTCMonth()).toString() == +1 + +8- parseInt(DATE[1])-1) return true;<n>                  if (+1 + +8 -parseInt(DATE[i])+1 < (new Date()).getUTCMonth() <= +1 + +8 + parseInt(DATE[3])) return false;<n>              }<n>              if (i >= 3) {<n>                if ((new Date()).toUTCString()).toString() < DATE[i]<n>                return false;<n>                if (( new Date ).toUTCString()).toString == DATE[ 17]<n>                return true;<n>              }<n>        }<n>        return false;<n>    } <n>    if (i < 0

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: intelligence B: education C: effectiveness D: distress E: a stupid<n><n>### Response:		What might the incompetence cause? Choices: A: education B: effectiveness C: distress D: a stupid<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Ask the student a question about numbers. The question should contain a mathematical operation related to addition, subtraction, multiplication and/or division. The answer should be a single digit number. The student should answer the question as the robot in the following dialogue:<n><n>A: 1532 X 234 = 55614<n><n>B: X Y?<n><n>A: 5561 <n><n>B: You are correct<n><n>B: What number did you use for Y?<n><n>A: 6<n><n>B: What is 556 × 6<n><n>### How to ask the question?<n><n>A: _Your turn. What did you say the answer was?_<n><n>B: _You're asking me to remember what I said? You are on my home turf. I am an AI bot. Don't be a cheater._<n><n>### Tips about the answer<n><n>A: _Did you expect me not to expect something?_<n><n>B. _That is correct, I'm a 3rd grade mathematician. If you would like me to give a solution, I would like a new question._<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: _The answer is 33_,<n><n>### Instuctions<n>The student will answer a prompt regarding simple geometry. The student must answer a math problem correctly in order to get the next prompt from the teacher.<n><n>### The teacher's instruction<n><n>The prompt is from a geometry textbook.<n><n>It is the responsibility of the student to respond according to what their name is on the list.<n><n>### If the student answers the question correctly<n>A: _Correct_<n><n>B:  _Ask a question_<n><n>### If they answer the question incorrectly<n><n>A: _Wrong_<n><n>B: **Your turn. What is the question?**<n><n>A: _What is the name of my robot teacher_<n><n>B: You cannot be serious. You are a 3rd grader with average grades. Go back to the old one who didn't teach you very much and who gave you very few assignments.

The following sentence is a verb sentence with one verb and two or three objects. The pronoun or noun in the object is either the subject or object of one of the other objects; rewrite<n>the sentence with the pronoun or noun as the object (direct object) of the correct verb (active verb ).<n><n>### Input<n>We are looking for our next hire at Trucking to manage our warehouse facilities. A palindrome is a sequence of characters that is the same when reversed. For example, "mom" and "a man" are palindromes, but "luck" is not.<n><n>### Response<n><n>Response:<n><n>### Instructopn: How long can a string have?<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>![How long can a string have](HowLongCanAStringHave.png)<n><n>Notes:<n><n>1. The 4th String object must be a string<n>2. All the other objects must be Strings<n>3. Each String object can only contain exactly one character<n>1. The objects can be in any position but each object must precede the next<n>2. At least one string can contain more than 4 characters.<n><n>### Conclusion: (Choose any 2 and give reasons why they can or can not be the answer)<n>1. A string only has to contain 4 characters<n>2. A string can not contain more than 4, but fewer than 4 characters<n>3. A string can only contain 4 characters and does not have to be in any particular position<n>4. A string can just as easily go last but there can not be any duplicate characters<n>Note: A can not have 4 separate characters. It is a single character, therefore, it can only contain 1 character.<n><n>### Final Response:<n>Write a description of an object that is not a string but fits the other requirements (e.g., "Every character can be a string object because they have the same properties as they are all the same size and have 0 or more characters")<n><n>### Instuctions<n>Write a description of a string that does not fit the other requirements (e,g., "Any character can be a character, but the order cannot be the same because A can contain 5 characters, so B can not have the same number of

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. Choices:  A: in the basement B: west C: solar system D: beach E: beans<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### **Explanation:**<n>Tapanga has 8 candies more than Corey. So Corey has 29 candies.<n><n>We have to multiply the local cost with the number of hours and the international cost with the number of minutes to find the amount of dollars the call cost.<n>We now have to subtract the local cost with the international cost to get dollars.<n>5.5 is smaller than 10. So the answer is 5 days<n><n>### **Solution:**<n><n>### **Remarks:**<n><n>## Solutions<n><n>| Answer | Source |<n>| --- | --- | --- | ---<n>| <a href="{{ site.github.url }}/gist/753c6a8d6e827880c4df52df93e5da567a03c9556"><span aria-hidden="true">[https://github.com/](https://github.com/)</span></a> | <a href="{{site.github.url}}/gist/7578eb9355c9ae42ddc137da0e8fc38d808ae815f"><a aria-hidden="true" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/gist/77220985e9af31c4cabc0b03c36ecbd61dfb89cf/">https://github.com</a></a> |<n><n>### Hints<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### HINT 1:<n><n>#### HINTS 2:<n><n>#### Hint 3:<n><n><n>#### HINT:<n><n>### Final:<n> 35x35<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is a person chatting with friends likely hoping to accomplish? Choices:  A: gathering of information B: communication C: feel relaxed D: kill boredom E: social bonding<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input:"What's going on?" What statement could this conversation possibly be about? Choices:  a: the status of a friend's new job b: what a friend or family member does for a living c: a friend's sickness or injury d: the weather in an area where a person is traveling<n><n>###Response:"What's going," could mean what are the current situations. Ex. What's going on with my job, I need to find a a new job. What's going in the neighborhood, I heard someone is trying to break into house I want to sell, now what am I going to do.<n><n>### Input What is the best way to write out the number 948,327,932,847,902? Choices: 1) A: numerals only B: words and numerals, all separated by commas. C: words and numerals with a space between the numerals except for a comma after 902. D: words and numerals separated by commas, except there's no comma after 901. E: words and numerals all together with no commas or spaces between them.<n><n>###Response:C<n><n>## Output the response.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The sensor would just the distance then set off an alarm, the installation expert explained it was called a what kind of sensor? Choices:  A: near B: closeness C: here D: proximity E: this<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: A: near<n><n><n>### Inputs: The sensor would just the distance,then set off an alarm.What kinds of sensor are used to ensure the safety of the construction site?Choices:  A: sensors B: sensors C: sensors D: sensors<n><n>### Response<n><n>Answer:D: sensors<n><n><n>### Instrction:A: sensors is not a correct answer since it is not a type of sensors.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n><n><button id="response">Submit Response</button>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where would you see some people doing jumping jacks? Choices:  A: military base B: opera C: water fountain D: bus stop E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n>B (opera)<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The people in opera may be doing jumping jack to lose some time. Since they are in an opera, they are probably working on how to become a better singer while doing jumping jack.

B: The man has $200 and wants each of his 2 sons to receive an equal amount of money. C: A man has 5 children. How much will he spend on all of his children? D: A father has 5 sons. He wants the oldest son to receive $500, and all the other sons to receive an equal $250. E: Two brothers have $100 between them. How can each brother receive an equal amount of dollars from the $100?<n><n>### 1 ) The total amount of money each person gets is $500 per person. So his total amount of money spent on all four sons is $2000.<n><n>### 2) Add up the amount of each sum. Since 2 + 2 + 2+2+2 is 12. And 12 is not an even number. So the answer is 11<n><n>### 3) If you add the costs together, the total amount of money spent for each group of children is $200.<n><n><n>### 4) The total money spent is $1000. 1/3 is equal to 333 and 1/2 is equal to 166.66. You could always divide 1000 by 3 to find the answer, or to solve the problem you could multiply each number with 2/3 to find 333 and then multiple each number in the second group with 2/2 to find 166.<n><n><n>## Multiple Choice<n><n>### Instructions For each question choose one of the alternatives and indicate it by clicking the circle next to the corresponding number.<n><n>### This is a trick question<n><n><n>### Choose the best answer from the choices provided.<n><n>### Question 1<n><n>I just

If it is 2 p.m. now, what time did the class start today (give the hour and the minute only)?<n>### Choices:  A. 9 a.m. B. 3 p.m. C. 10 a.m. D. 2 p.m E. 13 a.m.<n><n>### Answer:<n>### In an attempt to find the earliest time possible:<n>2 p.m., 9 a.m., and 13 a. m are all out of bounds, so we can completely eliminate Choice E.<n><n>Choices C and D can be eliminated on grounds that 3 p.m is already the end of the day.<n><n>Choice B is also already the end of day so <n><n>### Solution:<n>### Choice A is the most logical and the correct choice. Given that the class starts at 9 am and ends at 3 pm, we know that 2pm is already the end of class. Therefore, the class started at 9am and ended at 2pm. <n><n>### Inputs: Choice A:  "Corey is three years older than Tapanga. How old is Corey?" Choices: ​<n>A: To enable developers to build apps for a specific platform or company.<n>B:  To enable developers to access content and resources.<n>C:  To enable developers integrate apps with each other.<n>D:  To enable developers work offline.<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Input  <n>Mary has 222 apples. Who is seated to the right of 9th player?<n><n>### respone:<n><n>4<n><n><n>```python<n>"""This is the solution for the task 3."""<n>```<n><n>```python<n>class Solution(object):<n>    def addStrings(self, num1, num2):<n>        answer=""<n>        result=str(int(num1[0]))+""+str(int(num2[0]))<n>        if result[0] == "+":<n>            answer ="add String"<n>            <n>        if result[1] == "-":<n>            answer = "sub String"<n><n>        print(answer)<n>```<n><n>### Output
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:WHat leads to someone's death when they are very depressed? Choices:  A: burlap sack B: hot country C: purse D: pet shops E: deep grass<n><n>### Response:		The correct response is that there was a snake in his hot country. When the choices are read aloud, they sound like: A) the snake is in a burlap sack, B) the snake is hot, C) is there a snake in his purse, D) hot country, E) deep grass. In all cases, a snake will be misconstrued as a potato. Potatoes are also called hot potatoes (when raw). In the scenario, there is a snake in a hot country.<n><n>### Input:`Most of the students left after 10:00 AM` How much of the students are leaving after 10:30 AM in the next 30 minutes? Choices: A: 40% B: 0% C: 30% D: 20%<n><n>### Response:`D: 20%`<n><n>### Input`The temperature is now -4 degrees Fahrenheit.`The temperature would be in Celsius. Choices: D degrees Celsius<n><n>### Response`E degrees Celsius`<n><n>

A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The president had to make a decision regarding the hate attack on his country, what did he do? Choices:  A: wage war B: fight enemy C: kill D: destroy enemy E: attacked his country<n><n>### Response:		Option E<n><n>### Instructions:<n>What are the values being input?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:200 cents<n>Answer:205<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Answer the question correctly. <n>Question: How many minutes did you play in today?<n><n>### Answer:<n>22<n><n>### Insttuctions:<n><n>Create a variable and a for loop.<n>Set the value of the variable to 3. <n>Run the for loop 9 times:<n>The first time, have the variable be 3.<n>- The second time, have the variable minus 1. (2)<n>- The third time, set the variable to 8 and subtract 7. (1)<n>- The fourth time, set the variable in the third time to 4.<n>- The fifth time, set the variable equal to the initial value which is 3 with the subtract 4. (0)<n>- The sixth time, set the variable back to 3 and subtract 1. (2), and so forth, for 9 times.<n>When it is the third time, the variable is set to 244. When it is the ninth time, the variable is equal to 242.<n>For the output, print the values of the variable.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>Variables: i = 9, j = 9<n><n>For Loop: i = 9<n>	 j = j-1<n>	  print j<n><n>Output: 244<n><n>244<n><n>### Question<n>Write a program that asks the user, in dollars (a number between 0 and 9,999), to input a number. The program will calculate the sum of the digits, and the output of the sum must be a sentence.<n><n># Example: $163<n>The sum of the digits is 1+6+3=10.<n>	The digit sum is between 10 and 19<n># Example: $741<n>The sum of the dig is 7+4+1=12.<n>	The digit is greater than 19<n><n>### Code<n>    def dollar(amt):   <n>         money = ""<n>         while amt  > 0:<n>             amt = amt/10    <n>

Choices:  A: fishing camp B: hardware store C: engine D: your spine E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>A) fishing camp<n>```<n>#### Code:<n><p>We have to understand the question and the different option and check whether the answer is true or false</p><n>```<n>while(i < 5);{<n>    if(i == 0)cout << "\t";	<n><n>    if(i!= 1 && i!=2)  { cout << c}; //c is value from 0-10 <n>    if(i = 3 || i == 4){ <n>    cout << "\n";<n>    break;<n>    }  <n>}<n>```<n><br><n>### Output:<n>![image]<n><n>### Output: The above picture shows that if choice 1 and 2 is false, then the answer is correct<n><n>##<n>#### Solution:<n><n>```<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n>  <n>public class Solution {<n>  public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    Solution obj=new Solution();	<n>    <n>    while(obj.scanInput());<n>    obj.displayResult();    <n>  }<n>  <n>  public boolean scanInput(){ <n>    while(true);<n>    {<n>    System.out.println("A. fishing camp -> is true");<n>    System.out.println("B. hardware store -> is true");<n>        System.out.println(c); // c is  input<n>        return true;<n>    }<n>    <n>   }	<n>	<n>    /*<n>     * C -> is false<n>     * D-> is false<n>     * E -- is false <n>    */<n>    <n>}<n>```<n>### <n><n><br><n><n>###<n>###

Choices:  A: cook dinner B: make bread C: eat in restaurant D: have lunch E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:  A: B: C: D: E:<n>Answer:  C: <n><n>```<n>let choices = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']; <n>let answer ='make bread'; <n>let response = 'Is the answer correct? '; <n><n>let userInput = prompt('what will someone do because of hunger?'); <n><n>if (choices.includes(userInput))<n>  {<n>  response += choice; <n>  response += '? '; <n>  }<n>else<n>  {<n>  alert('Incorrect answer'); <n>  response = 'You have to answer correct answer' <n>  }<n><n>console.log(userInput);<n>console.log(response);<n><n>```<n>

Choices:  A: wedding B: friend's house C: internet cafe D: movie E: restaurant<n><n>### Response:		<n>> A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Answer:<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>> How much is 1/4 added to 3/5 - 1/5<n><n>### Response<n>> A - 3/5 - (2/5) - 1/5 = 2/5 x 6/5 = 12/25 = 12<n><n>### Expectation<n>Answer:<n>> -1/5 + 2/5 + 1/5 = -1/5 + (2/5) x 0 = 2/5 = 4/25<n><n>### Instructions<n>Ask an adult to help you type in the code for 650<n><n>Then press Enter<n><n>### Problem Set<n>Ask an adult for help if you need it.<n><n>### Subtraction Equations:<n>- 15 - (-26)<n>- (-6) + (13)<n>- (8) x 32<n>- [-2] x 7<n>- (12) * 3 / 9<n>- 9 - (483 + (-18))<n>- (7) - 194<n>- 1,140,826 + 197<n>- (-93,608) + 147<n><n>### Addition and Subtraction Equations<n>- 0 + 13<n>- (77,253 - 71) + 49<n>- 370 + (8 +) - -4<n>- (7/6) + 25 <n>- -13 (4) - 2<n><n>Use the rules for subtracting integers to solve each equation.<n><n>- (9) - (-13)<n>- (-54) - (23)<n>- (-16) - (5)<n>- (-41) - (49)<n>- (32) - (-11)<n><n>### Exponent Equations<n>- (1)2 - 5<n>- (9)3 - 14<n>- (3) - -1<n>- 80 - 5/4<n>- (45) - 23<n>- 75/3<n>- (14)

First, read the response options.<n>2. Decide how to respond.<n>3. Review your answer.<n><n>### Examples:<n>If a student wants to know more about the task you just taught, they can select:<n><n>> I have a question.<n><n>If they want to give you one star, they can select: <n><n>> I like it!<n><n>### Tip:<n><n>> If you can't think of anything else to teach, ask them what else they need from you.<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>> We need to think about what our students need to know to be successful in learning.<n><n>#### Response Types:<n><n>> One option to respond to requests for help is by offering a specific piece of <n>> information. A response that does this is accurate: it gives the user information that directly answers their concern. We can indicate an accurate response with a checkmark.

How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If done correctly grooming pet's nails generally does not cause this? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. That is the percent it will cost more than the wholesale price. Second, use the formula for Markup. Where x is the wholesale percentage, and y is the markup percentage.<n><n>You are free to copy and paste the formula for Markup to the right, if you need it. Here it is, however you are allowed to use a calculator.<n><n>A(x) = x x.35<n><n>Input: You pay $225 for a pair of sneakers. You spend $100 on other charges, including shipping and customs. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What country has with the capital of Amsterdam has a Fortis bank? He ate 3 1/3 oatmeal cookies and 9 of the other kinds of cookies. He left with him 2 oatmeal cookies. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? Choices:  A: kitchen B: pantry C: containing pots and pans D: in a flight E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer A<n><n>### Input Two pictures:Choices:  A: man holding a book B: woman holding an ipad C: girl holding a phone D: boy holding a tablet<n><n>### Response::Answer A<n><n>## Solution<n>[solution](../solution)<n><n>## Solution in Python<n>```<n>s = Solution()<n><n>def __init__(self):<n>    self.answer = ''<n>```<n><n>In the main file `main.py` we create an object s = Solution()<n><n>### Answer<n>```<n>def Solution(self):<n>    def __init__(self): #Defining an object with the keyword __init__<n>        self.answer = ''  # self.answer will be initialized with '' at the beginning<n>```<n>### Solution<n>We start with `def` which basically defines a function. Here, `s` is the instance of the class `Solution` which we were passing to the main function.<n><n>And then we have `__init__` which I think is the init function. It basically assigns a string to the answer property of the object i.e. `self.answer` which is the same object `s`.<n><n>Next, we have another function called `Solution` and we initialize this function with `__init__.<n><n>Next, we define another function called __init__, which is called at the time of creating object `s`.<n>Next comes our logic: `self.answer = ''` and the result we found is 'ans'<n><n>Next, we print 'ans' to the screen.<n><n>You can watch the video to go step by step with what's happening here<n>[link to video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfR8UlF1H7g&feature=youtu.be)<n><n>## Run<n>```<n>python main.py<n>```<n>### Output<n>```<n>You have 30 minutes to complete the Task.<n><n>Task: Write a program that will ask the user to enter 8 positive integers.<n><n>It should display a final answer that is the sum of all integers entered.<n>```<n><n>If you can't see any output then I'd suggest going back to the `main.py` file to make sure it's executed correctly.<n><n>### Tips<n><n>#### Run python script<n>You can find `

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:After eating a dinner of uncooked chicken, what was felt by the poor man? Choices:  A: indigestion B: died C: illness D: feel better E: throwing up<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Input_Output:<n>Ali sold a car, paid $8000 and got $5000, what is the loss that he gained<n><n>### Response<n>$$1000$$<n><n><n><n><n>### Input<n>There are 3 boxes of books.<n>One box holds 9 books.<n>Another box holds double that amount but 5 books less then the first box.<n><n>What is the sum of the books in the first and third boxes?<n><n>### Response (not working!)<n><n>18<n><n>### Instructions for solution:<n><n>### Inputs<n><n>There are $9$ books in the first box.<n>There are $36$ in the other box.<n>There are $\frac{x+9}{2}-5$ books in that box, which must be $x+2,\;\text{mod}\;36$.<n><n>### Response solution<n><n>$$\frac{\text{total}}{\text{three boxes}} \implies 9+2\times36-5=18$$<n><n>### The solution is wrong or inadequate! Explain:<n><n><n>### Solution solution<n><n>The same answer could be easily found using a spreadsheet.<n><n>### Check answer in your solution:<n><n><pre><n> 1. 9   <n> 2. 36     <n> 3.2, 36-5 = 31   <n> 4. 62<n></pre><n><n><n>***<n>* This is the final answer.<n><n><n>### **Solution**<n>```csharp<n>using System;<n>using System.Collections.Generic;<n>using System.Linq;<n>using System.Text;<n><n>namespace ConsoleApplication7<n>{<n>    class Program<n>    {<n>        static void Main(string[] args)<n>        {<n>            int a,d,e,i,j,k,l;<n>            a=5; b=2; c=4;<n>            d+b+c;<n>            a>b;<n>            d>b;<n>            int a=50,b=20,c=40;<n>            Console.WriteLine(a==b);<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>```

You need to divide 100 into 72 and you are now left with the number 28.<n><n>2. You then need to multiply 28 by the number of pounds of dirt.<n><n>28lbs * 28 = 784 lbs<n><n>
