Which is greater: $\$2.86 or \$6.63$?<n>Answer:<n><n>Input: Which number is closest to: $.39 -.11?<n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructors Guide<n>This task is to compare dollar amounts. This is part of the larger classroom curriculum for first grade to teach comparison and addition/subtraction. This task is meant to check if the student can tell which is greater between two given amounts. Each of these questions contains two numbers, and the student needs to read the numbers and answer which is greater, 8.50 or 10.55, and 2.86 or 6.63 etc. The tasks have been formatted slightly differently so that each group can complete each task to create a set of two, six, etc. <n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input: 8.50 > or 10.15?<n>Response: 8.5 < 10.5<n><n>Input:6.86 > or 6.92?<n>Response:6.86 < 6.92<n><n>Input: 10.50 < 10.95?<n>Response:10.5 < 11.0<n><n>Input:6 > or 4?<n>Response:6 < 4<n><n>Input: 2.34 > 1.7?<n>Response:2.34 < 1.7<n><n>Input: Which value is larger, 145 or 155?<n>Response:Which value is larger, 200 or 250?<n><n>Input: What is smaller, 23.5 or 58?<n>Response:Which number is smaller: $209 or $208?<n><n>### Response Help<n>This task is for students to identify the greater of two given numbers. Students can work in groups to build up a practice to answer this task. The questions have been formatted to give them a better chance to learn to read, determine, and answer correctly. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:After going for run you have a sense of what? Choices:  A: satisfaction B: flying C: sweating D: falling down E: trip<n><n>### Response:		What the instructor is looking for is the feeling after going for run.<n><n>### Input A: Choices:A: a A:a  A:a  A:"A" A:"A"  A:"a" B: a B:a  B:a  B:"a" B:a C: a C:a  C:a  C:"a" C:"a"  C:a D: a D:a  D:a  D:"a" D:a E: a E:a  E:a  E:"a" E:"a"  E:a<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>For each case, write a response to the input data that you think the instructor would like to see.<n><n>### Your Turn! Task Input Your answer goes here<n><n>### Your Answer<n><n>You may write your response here.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What will you need to do to decide whether to be seeing artifacts? Choices:  A: learning B: painful memories C: thinking D: awe inspiring E: pleasure<n><n>### Response:		Choice C: thinking<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The answer is option C, thinking.<n><n><n>### Instructions: Answer each question.<n><n>## Demonstration: <n>Input: Tapanka and Corey have 84 candies together. Choices:  A: suffering B: he was happy C: avoid problems D: unhappy E: end pain<n><n>### Response:		 B (he was happy)<n><n>### Input 1: A man is driving home when he suddenly comes to a red light, he then proceeds to turn off his engine. While waiting at the red light, he realizes that he's in the middle of the intersection without lights. He starts to sweat in fear as he notices a police car approaching at high speeds. However, before the police car gets to the intersection, the light turns green and he's able to drive away from the light. The man asks for your advice concerning the incident.  A: The man should have turned off his engine while waiting at the red light.<n><n>B: The man should have waited for the police car to get to the intersection before driving away.  <n><n>### Input2:A man is driving in a car on a highway and he loses his cell phone. While he's driving, there's a man on a bus who spots the phone. The man who spotted the phone asks a man in a truck to stop for him so he could get off and get the phone. The man in the truck realizes that there's a policeman behind him who flashes his lights at him to signal for him to stop the truck. The policeman then asks for the man in the truck's ID. Choices: A: The three people should have waited at the nearest gas station until the policeman got off work. <n><n>B: The three people should ignore the policeman and continue driving.<n><n>### Answer:  A and then B (He had no way to contact his family or the police so he needed to keep on going and that would help prove that he was no dangerous or harming anyone)<n><n>### Answered: A:<n><n>### Instructions:The following dialogue takes place between a man and a woman in a diner.<n><n>Man: Hi, my name is John. Can you please take my order?  Woman: Hello, my name is Liz. How can I help you?<n><n>Man: I'd like to have 5 eggs.<n><n>Woman: You want to eat 5 eggs?<n><n>Man: Yes, I want to eat 5 of your eggs.<n><n>Women: Oh, sorry for interrupting, so the only thing is 5 eggs?<n>Man: Yes, 5 eggs.<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Choices:  A: sheath B: sword closet C: collection D: container called scabbard E: museum<n><n>### Response:		Answer according to: [A E C B]<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question below.<n><n><n>### Input:(1) Dollie has a pair of shorts. One side of her shorts is green and the other side of shorts is blue. The green side has a red bow in the front and a large yellow flower at the back. The blue side of her shorts has a bright pink bow in the front, and has two blue flowers in the back. Which side of shorts is on the left side when you put the front of her shorts in toward you with your hand out? <n><n>### Answer:<n><n>The bow that is on the Green side of shorts is left of her shorts. The bow that is on the Blue side of shorts is right of her shorts. (If it is still confusing, take a piece of paper and draw a pair of shorts, you draw the bow in the front and the flower in the back on the blue side of shorts. Then on green side of shorts draw an arm that is the green shorts in toward yourself with your hand out to see which bow is on your left side and which bow is on your right side.)<n><n>### Response:(2) Explain your answer: The green side is the Left side.<n><n>### Input : (2) Which side of the shorts is on the right side when you put the back of her shorts to you?<n><n>### Answer : The pink bow that is on the blue side is to the right of her shorts side.<n><n>## Input :How many minutes do 334,435,70,96,418,1841,55 make?<n><n>### Response :Thirty-nine hours and nine minutes<n><n>### Response and Input: What is the most popular Christmas Tree type? They can also not be described as small and underground.<n><n>### Soln<n>Buildings can be described as undergourd, high and huge. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where are you likely to find a professional prostitute? Choices:  A: new york B: whorehouse C: street corner D: corner of two streets E: brother<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:(Please fill this in by providing the exact content to give your answer meaning.)<n><n>### Response:(Please fill this in with your instructional response.)<n><n>I don't know, she was only with me for a week.<n><n>What did Jack say to the dog?<n><n>I don' t know what to do next.<n><n><n>### Response (Write a response that appropriately includes an answer key.):<n><n>```<n><Response><n>I dont know where to go to look for my uncle. I was at a park and I saw a man there who told me he was a professional prostitute, but he is really my uncle<n></Response><n>```<n>Write an appropriate response to complete the request:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: "I dont know what to do next."<n><n>### Input (Please fill this in by describing the details of the problem):<n><n>### I don't know what to do next<n><n>### Response(Write an appropriate response):<n><n>**Responses:**<n><n>```<n> <Response><n>	I dont know what to next<n></Response><n><Response><n>	You might want to ask someone.<n></Response><n>	<Response><n>		You might want to take a class.<n></Response>

Write the new version of the sentence using the revision strategy shown.<n><n>"I hate that book. It's boring as can be."<n>Write:<n>"I hate that boring book. As can be, it's boring."<n><n>[![](screenshot.jpg)](screenshot.jpg)<n><n>### Instructions:For this section there will be two options for the task. Choose one that you will complete.<n><n>### Option 1: Rewrite the following sentences using parallel structure.<n><n>### Example:<n>Crystal bought a new computer, a laptop, and a printer.<n><n>### Response 1:Crystal bought a, laptop, and a printer., new computer.<n><n>### Input  :Crystal bought a printer, a laptop, and, a new computer. <n><n>### Option2: Use a comparison to write the sentence that demonstrates the most contrast.<n>#### Instructions:In most situations, you will have to consider various options before choosing one. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:They were competing in basketball, the goal was to what? Choices:  A: bounce the ball B: competition C: have fun D: race E: score points<n><n>### Response:		Their goal was to compete in basketball, the choices A, B, C, D, and E were just a mix-up<n><n>### Input<n><n>What is the value of the product, 3 ⋅ 7 + 8 ⋅ 9?<n><n>### Input answer<n><n>The product is 224<n><n>## What's the opposite of "minus"?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>The opposite is "plus"<n><n>## Input<n><n>What is 9 − 2 + 8?<n><n>### Answer <n><n>The number is 7<n><n>What is the answer to 38 ÷ 8?<n><n>### Answer:<n>The number is 6<n><n>### Input question:<n>How much of the cereal is in the 4th box if the 4th box contains 3 ounces less than an 8 ounce box?<n><n>### Response<n><n>How much of the boxes will be 5 ounces?<n><n>### Explain your answer<n><n>I subtract 38 -6 = 32 I know 40 = 4 boxes 14 ÷ 4 = 3.5 of 4 boxes equals 3 ounces per ounce<n><n>### Expand your reasoning!<n><n>Cereal in box = 14/4 = 3.<n><n>Insight:<n><n>Thinking and Reasoning:<n><n>```<n>14/4 =3<n>14-4 =10<n>10*4/4=8<n>4*3/(3+1)=4<n>```<n><n>I subtracted 4 ÷2 = 2, divide 3 by 2 is 1.5 I know that I can get 1.5, or 2 ounces in 1 ounce if I multiply by 2.

Choose one writing piece that you have submitted as an assignment, or one that you plan to submit in the future, and revise it for grammatical errors. After you've revised it, check to make sure you've corrected any grammatical errors of your choice by using this rubric.<n><n>### Checklist:<n><n>### 1. 4 or more errors?<n><n>### 2. Incorrect capitalization or spelling on first word of sentence<n><n>### 3. 2 errors and/or first word of sentence has incorrect capitals or spelling<n><n>### 4. Correct capitalization and spelling on first word<n><n>### 5. Incorrect word order and/or incorrect word endings<n><n>### 6. 2 errors and correct word order and/or word endings<n><n><n><n>### 7. Correct word order and/or correct word endings<n><n>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The snake was a cottonmouth.  It was an American, from where? Choices:  A: georgia B: tree C: nature D: under the rocks E: france<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is E) France<n><n>### Inputs: A man was riding his horse in the city center, and came to a junction. A sign read, "Cross the road in 6 minutes." How many minutes did the man have to wait to get across the road?<n><n>### Response <n>The correct answer is F) 6<n><n>### Input : <n>There are 26 people in the park. 23 of them wore blue shirts and 12 of them wore pink shirts. From this information, what can we say about the number of people who wore blue and pink?<n><n>Ans: 40 people wore blue and pink shirts <n><n>### Input #3 <n>Alice had 2 times as many apples as Bob. If she also had 4 apples more than Jake, how many apples did Jake have?<n><n>Ans : 8 <n><n>### Output<n>14 is A, 19 is B, 12 is C, 8 is D, and 16 is E.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A person takes a seat to watch a movie, where is he? Choices:  A: in cinema B: at the park C: martorell D: jeep E: airplane<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If answer C is selected. He is at the park.<n><n>If answer A is selected. He is in cinema.<n><n>If answer B is selected. He is near martorell.<n><n>If answer E is selected. He is on an airplane.<n><n>### Input : A person travels from his house to his workplace and back. Choices : A: Walking B: Motorcycle C: bicycle D: car<n><n>### Response :<n><n><n>If answer D is selected he takes car.<n><n>If answer C or B is selected. He takes bicycle or motorcycle. <n><n>### Input<n>How much milk does it take to fill a milk crate? Choices:<n>A. 2 qts B. 3 ½ qts<n>C. 4 qts D. 1 qt<n><n>### Response<n>If answer C or D is selected. It takes 1 or 4 qts.<n><n>If answer D or A is selected. It takes in total 7 qts or 10 qts.<n>            <n>### Input : You have 100 chips and you want a total of 110 chips. How many more chips do you need? Choices : A. 1 B. 6 C. 2 D. 9<n><n>### Response <n><n>If answer B or C is selected. We need 6 or 2 more chips.<n><n>If answer  D is selected. We need total 10 more chips.<n>            <n>## Input : How many candies are given to each person if you want each person to get a different number of candies? Choices : A: 12 B: 9 C: 7 D: 5<n><n>## Response<n><n>If answer D  or B is selected.<n>There is 5 candies.<n><n>If answer any answer other than 5 candies is selected. There is no different candies.<n><n>## Input : How big is the largest dog? Choices:<n><n>A. 10 kg B. 10<n><n>C. 30 kg D. 35 kg  <n><n>## Response<n>If answer B or D is selected. The largest dog is 35 kg.<n><n>If any answer other than 35 kg is selected. The largest is not

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. G) Is it wrong to feel love for someone?<n><n>### Input<n>A: 50% of humans are lefties.<n>B: 80% of lefties are male.<n>C: 25% of the world's population is Chinese.<n>D: 48% of the people in Chinese cities are lefties.<n>E: 5% of the worlds population is female.<n>Answer: Choices:  C) There are about 1.3 billion Chinese and more than 100 million of them are lefties. That means there are more left-handed Chinese than female, which I find surprising.<n><n>### Input <n>A: There are 66 sheep.<n>B: Every third sheep is black.<n>C: The color of the remaining sheep is not always known.<n>D: 2 sheep that are alike color are mates and are never separated.<n>E: 9 sheep have been removed from the flock.<n>F: There is one sheep, whose color is not known, whose number is not divisible by any other sheep in the flock.<n>G: There are 12 black sheep in the flock now.<n>H: Some sheep are removed. <n>Answers: Choices:  There are 5 sheep not known, 3 sheep have died, 1 sheep is added.<n><n>### Question <n>How many green sheep are there?<n><n>### Answer<n>I have 8 sheep. The 1 sheep I do not know about is green. I then remove 5 sheep from my flock. This leaves me with 8 sheep total. I then remove 4 sheep who are mates. This leaves me with four green sheep. <n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Solution<n>Choices:<n>A:  The number of candles at the event is not the same as the number of parties attended.<n>B: 33 people attended the event total.<n>C: 31 people attended one party, 29 people attended two parties, and one

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Why is this person not listening to music? Choices:  A: fall asleep B: relaxation C: deafness D: bored E: calm<n><n>### Response:		<n>Because that person had to turn off the music to sleep with his partner.<n><n>### Solution:<n>This is the solution provided by instructor.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Input 1: Tapanga and Claire have 86 candies together. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If people are vegetarian, what do they do more of? Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n><n>### Response:		<n>If people are vegetarian then what do they do:<n><n>1.  B: sun themselves Certainly! The sun helps plants grow bigger and more abundant.<n>2.  A: believe in God <n>Because all creatures eat plants, God made vegetarians.  <n>  <n>C: eat hamburges This might be true, but hamburgers are made of beef which is also a plant.<n><n>3.  D: gain wealth.  I agree with this. Vegetarians have more money than others, because they don't need much as the plants provide for them and they consume less food.<n><n>4.  E: eat plants Everyone in the world eats plants.  <n><n>### InputThe cost of a car is 1000 dollars more than 12 times its first year price. The first year price of a car multiplied by the cost of a car gives a total of 8400. Find the original price of the car.<n><n>### ResponseThe original price of the car:<n>\* 1000x+12x=8400<n>\* x=8000<n>\* Original price =8000<n><n>### QuestionFor what positive integer does m+n+o+p+q+r+s+t+u+v=15?<n><n>### Response For: 15 positive integer?<n>\* m=3<n>\* n=10<n>\* o=1<n>\* p=7<n>\* q=3<n>\* r=5<n>\* s=9<n>\* t=11<n>\* u=1<n><n>\* v=4<n>\* Total = 15<n>### Question:<n>Mom had $1920 at the bank and spent $2905 more than she had. How much did she keep at the bank?<n><n>### Solution:<n>Input : 1920<n><n>Mom spent 2905 more for the bank then she had at the start. Mom at the bank had $1925 <n>1920 + 2905 = 4825<n><n>4825 - 1925 = $2900<n><n>Mom saved 29

De lo contrario, el balon haría mucho daño al jugador si era golpeado. Un ejemplo es que un jugador golpea la bola al mismo tiempo, le gusta la bola con un hombre, le da al balon de gol como le encanta jugar a bola.<n><n>### Respues:How does your computer know how to display the letters and numbers on the screen?<n><n><n>### Answers :Elihu wants to make a card game for Christmas. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where do you keep a teakettle? Choices:  A: cupboard B: countertop C: water D: hardware department E: england<n><n>### Response:		<n>The kettle is kept in England's hardware department.<n><n>### Input<n>What kind of an animal is a horse? Choices: <n><n>A: an elephant <n><n>B: a lion <n><n>C: a deer <n><n>D: a whale <n><n>E: a donkey <n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct answer is 'A' (the horse is an elephant ).<n><n>### Input Where do you keep a teapot? Choices:  'A' cupboard 'B' countertop 'C' water 'D' hardware department 'E' england<n><n>## <n>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where do you go to meet a friend who lives close to you? Choices:  A: workplace B: bus station C: social atmosphere D: neighbor's house E: at school<n><n>### Response:		What is the correct answer from A - E?<n><n>> <n>> >  A<n>> >  B<n>> >  C<n>> >  E<n>> >  None of the above<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>##> Instructions:Tapanga and Corey are having a food party. They invite 7 other students. Tapanga gives each student 3 hot dogs. Corey gives each student 4 hot dogs. How many more hot dogs did Corey give than Tapanga?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>##> Instruction: What does the task ask?<n><n>>  >  The task asks how many more hot dogs did Correy give than Tapanga<n><n>##> Instructor:Describe a way Correy's hot dogs were more than Tapanga's.<n><n>>  >   Corery gave 4 more hot dogs to the students.<n><n>### Inputs: <n><n>##> Instrument:Explain the correct answer by creating the following equation.<n><n>```<n><n>number of people = (total number of hot dogs * amount of hot dogs each person gets)<n><n>```<n>This is the equation that will be made to solve the problem<n><n>```<n>(7 + 3 + 4) =<n><n>```<n><n>```<n>(14 + 14 = 28 ) = 28 = 14<n><n>```<n><n>##> Instractor:Explain what values are in the equation.<n><n>>  <<n><n>```<n>number of people = 28<n><n>```<n><n>>  <n><n>```<n>total number of hot dogs = 14<n>```<n><n>``` ( amount of hot dogs each people get = 14)<n><n>```<n><n><n><n>```<n>solution of equation -<n><n>```<n><n>* 14 = 14<n>* 14/14 = 1 (it is showing if you divide them they will be equal)<n><n>## > Instructions:How does the equation show it worked properly?<n><n>>  < <n><n>```<n>the left side of the equation (number of people =14) <n><n>```<n><n>>`` the right side of the equation`>( 14/1)<n><n>```<n>The right side is equal to the left
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is a place where you usually store dishes but not books? Choices:  A: apartment B: pantry C: table D: living room E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is 'pantry'.<n><n>#### Commentary for solution:<n>The first letter of each of the choices is the same. So, since A,P,T and R all begin with the same letter, they cannot all be the answer.<n><n>There are 4 answers with a consonant on the left, so D cannot be the answer.<n>E is the answer with only A or O that can be the answer. The O and A can both be the answer because E has the same answer either way. So, E is out.<n><n>A, P and T all spell the letter R on the left, which means that they cannot be the answer. However, R is the only letter that all of the letters on the left can be. So, we can cross off B.<n><n>Since living room has an 'N', only living room and table can be the answer. Only living room is the answer because 'pantry' can also be an answer.<n><n>#### Commentary:<n>A = Apartment (A) N<n>P = Pantry (P) A<n>T = Table (T) E<n>R = room (R) E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input: You are going to the book store to buy something. You are a fan of Harry Potter. In each box, write a number that tells how many books from your list are the first to be crossed off. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>The books that are crossed off are "The Cuckoo's Nest", "To Kill a Mockingbird", and "The Lord of the Rings". (The last book has 3 stars to represent that it is crossed off first. Next down is second, and so on)<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Commentary for Solution<n><n>#### Commentary<n>The book with a star to the left of the top choice, will be the answer. <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The family was playing cards, what would be a reason for this? Choices:  A: amusement B: losing money C: charmed D: having fun E: win money<n><n>### Response:		A or D<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: What could we say about people who live with their parents? Choices: 1. they are still teenagers 2. they are living in poverty 3. they never graduated from college 4. they are dependent on their parents 5. they do not earn a living wage Input: What could we say if a person is a slacker? Choices: 6. they live alone 7. they are not financially stable 8. they never graduated from high school 9. they earn a living wag 10. they never left their house<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Instructors: Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### Exemplar:<n>Input: Which of the following would be an example of a job you don't need a college degree for? Choices:  Job 1: dental hygienist Job 2: bartender Job 3: mechanic<n>Answer: 2 and 3<n><n>Input: If you have a college degree, which of the following do you earn more money? Choices:  A: bathe B: bite C: die of cancer D: obesity E: copulate<n><n>### Response:		John is studying animals, so what he has to watch them do would be to observe them.<n><n>### Inputs:Ali buys 4 books, for $25. The books sell on Wednesday and Friday for $100, $160, $120, and $60. Write a program to calculate the profit Ali made from book sales.<n><n>### Expected Output: Ali needs to sell the other books to make the expected amount of money, but the books are in different amounts, so the best way is to add them 4 times.<n><n>### Solution #1:<n>def profit(bookSales):<n>   '''Total Price of the book = 60 + 80 + 100 + 160<n>   Return = 760 - 250<n>   Total Profit = 40'''<n>   totalPrice = 0<n>   for sale in bookSales:<n>       salePrice = (sale[0] * sale[1])<n>       totalPrice = totalPrice + salePrice<n>    profit = totalPrice - 250 #Total Profit 1<n><n>def profit(bookPrice):<n>   '''Total Profit = 4<n>   Return = 2*4 = 8, rounded to the nearest cent'''<n>   totalPrice1 = 0<n>   totalProfit = 0<n>   profitTotal = 4<n>   print("The total profit is {0} cents".format(4))<n><n>### Solution 2<n>def profit2(bookSales): #Careful with typing.<n>  '''Profit of Ali's book sales equals 400 - sale prices'''<n>  profit = bookSales[0][1] * 4<n>  profitValue = bookSales[1][1] * 3<n>  profitValue = 2 * profitValue<n>  profit = bookPrice + profitValue<n><n>def profit2(booksSold): #I'm not positive, but I think this is the right answer.<n>  '''Profits are in different quantities'''<n>  bookValue = booksSold[0]<n>  bookProfit = bookValue / 5<n>  profitValue = booksSold * 4<n>   profitValue = 0<n>   print("Profit = {0}".format(profitValue

The price of all the seats is greater than 1 and less than 1000.<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>### Instructiprn:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Example:<n><n>### Instinctions:<n>- Input: She'd sooner just spay herself with water than what she didn't the like the smell of.<n>- Demonstration: A: perfume B, air C: fountan D: swamp E :Puddle<n>- Response: S: Puddle<n>- Input: What does one put in milk so it’s not completely plain?<n><n>### ANSWER<n>- She’d sooner just splash herself the water with what she didn’t like the smell off.<n>- I was going to say perfume, but the problem is that she doesn’t like the smells. So I figured that the reason why she would wash herself with water was to be clean. However, water doesn’t taste good either, which leads me to believe that it’s a swamp.<n>- The correct answer is a swamp<n><n>### Input 1: You’re going to school and you live close to a certain school building, what does this suggest the other school buildings are close to? What is the output in the conditional?(7 - 3x)/2x - 5y<n><n>### Inputs : (7 - 3x<n>\begin{itemize}<n>\item 3x+5y)/2x<n>\end{itemize}<n><n>### Response :The second expression  (7-3x) / 3x+5<n>\begin{itemize}\item y = (-1/5)x<n>\end{code}<n><n>Input :The following expression is part of an arithmetic sequence. What is the output of 8th element?(2+4+6+8)/3<n><n>Inputs:2+4+6-8<n><n>Output :  (32-12)/(3)<n><n>Comment: Please provide your input and expected output in your code, that will help for others to understand your question properly and provide possible answers. If you are getting any error while editing it in your question, comment in this question.<n><n>Answer: You don't have to write a function, you need to return the answer of a particular task in a single line of code.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>int solution(int n, int m)<n>{<n>  if(n >= 1){<n>    return (n + m) / 2<n>  } else  {<n>    return 1;<n>  }<n>}<n><n>int main(){<n>  int n,m;<n>  scanf("%d%d",&n,&m);<n>}<n>\end{code]<n><n>You can achieve your task by splitting the problems into subproblems and each subproblem can be solved and you can easily convert your code in one liner.

A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		A and C<n><n>### Instructions: Input: Michael likes to play basketball with his friends every Saturday. The students do not see this instruction. The purpose is to instruct the students that when they use code blocks in text and submit their work for assessment, a parser program runs their assessment. The parser looks at all the code blocks in the text area, evaluates them, and produces a response. So what the students do in the text area is not necessarily what you see.<n><n>### Solution Template:<n>In the response template, students must demonstrate their understanding of the lesson by identifying the solution and explaining how they reached the answer. The response has four distinct sections, which should be labeled using text labels, images, or any appropriate format.<n><n>- **Instruction**: Write a response that appropriatly completes the request.   <n>- **Demonstration**:<n>- **Input**:<n>- **Output**:<n><n>###### Note: Students should respond to all four sections.<n><n>### Tech Support<n>The following is for your information and convenience:<n>![GIF that shows example of code blocks with the class name 'codeblocks' with an 'S' inside of the brackets.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43902465/107315669-4360f600-6b40-11eb-9f64-e3d771f2934e.gif)<n><n><n><n>![GIF that illustrates text with a number in the upper right corner which is highlighted by an 'S' on the left side of the number.](https://user-imgs.githubusercontent.co/43903720/107344530-6d4d7a80-6c68-11eb-8da4-005e41e5af44.gif)<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The people wanted to take the scenic route, they chose the highway that cut through the what? Choices:  A: countryside B: united states C: beach D: atlas E: developed land<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>A<n><n>B<n><n>C<n><n>D<n><n>E<n><n>### Input:(x + y) + z<n><n>### Response:(2x)(3y - 2z)<n><n>### Input:\_\(a^b\)<n><n>### Response:\_\(a\)<n><n>### Input :\_\(a^b\)^c<n><n>### Response :\_\(a^{\frac 12}\)^\frac 13a<n><n>### Input  :\_\(\sqrt \frac {n(n-3)(n-5)...(n-5n+2)}{2<n><n>### Response  :\_\(2\^(-20)\^7\)<n><n>### MultipleChoice Question :How many times will you be skipping 13 when you count on<n><n>### Response   :\_\(32\)<n><n>### You are making dinner for 5 friends. You will need to set the table with<n><n>### Response    :10 plates<n><n>

Which of the following could be a sum of the number of oranges and number of lemons in the crate?<n><n>### Choices: A: 23  B: 56  C: 60 D: 78  E: 87<n><n>### Response<n><n>> Choice C. lemons<n><n>### Explanation:The total number of fruit is 78.<n>```python<n>def problem1(input):<n>    # Code here<n>    if input == 'A':<n>        return 'wires'<n>    elif input == 'B':<n>        return 'lemons'<n>    elif input=='C': <n>        return 'oranges'<n><n>input = 'B'<n>result = problem1(input)<n>print(result)<n>```<n>

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. They stand on their legs and use the back legs for propulsion, which is how they run, hunt, and fight. They can see in color. This question will be the response question in the end.<n><n>I have created a sample program.<n><img src="code.png" alt = "code"/><n><n>The code in the program is :<n><n>```<n>import math<n><n>answer = ""<n><n>inp = str(input("Input: "))<n><n>if inp == "input":<n>    pass<n>elif inp == "queueing up":<n>    answer = "B"<n>else:<n>    answer = "A"<n>```<n><n>The answer is:<n><n>B<n>

At the start of your loop, compare the first letter to the last letter of the test string. If the first letters are the same, repeat the test for the second-to-last letters. If this test fails, continue with the next letters until the end of the test string.<n><n>### Output:True<n>Input: "abbba"<n><n>### Sample Input-Output:<n>Input "aacaba" will return false<n>```<n>$./exercise.c test.c<n>```

How much rice is in all three boxes? <n>## Solution: <n>If the last box holds 6 then:12 is held by the first box, 4 is held by the second box, and 4 is held by third box:12+4+4=20.<n>## Explanation: <n>The first box holds 2 times more: 12 times 10=12x10=1 and 1 and the second holds 4 times more: 4 times10=4x10=4.<n>The third holds2 times as much as the last holds: 2 times 6=2 x 6=12. The total is 20 if we add up the boxes. 1+2+4=7 then they add 20.<n>## Question:<n>Input: If the 3 boxes hold less (not more).<n>Explanation: The first box holds 2 and 1 holds 3 and the third holds 4 so they add up to 9.<n>Input: If the last box holds more.<n>Explanation: Three boxes contain 20(2+4+5), and the first 6 then the second 6 then the third 4 so it's 20+20+8=48.<n><n><n>## Input:Sugar cane is made up of many layers. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:It had a beach with shallow water, while not the ocean this was a hot spot all the locals enjoyed on the what? Choices:  A: swimming pool B: pond C: lake D: bathe in E: childrens pool<n><n>### Response:		A<n>### Explanation: Beach is not a ocean.<n><n>### Input:(Dogs are the best friends) of a dog: "I wish to have a dog for Christmas". Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. Charmed is not the correct answer. Charmed is a fictional town in the US where witches, vampires and others supernatural creatures live. Witches do not breathe.<n><br><n>B: Air from the space shuttle is not breathable, because it would not be able to support human life.<n><br>House: Air from a house can be breathed when you open windows or use a fan. It can also be breathed in when you go outside for some fresh air.<n><br>Train station: It is possible that the air at the train station has been breathed by people recently. However, I would not recommend having it as my breathing supply, since train stations have high levels of air pollution.<n><br>Surface of earth: If I were planning to spend a lot of time in space, I would definitely put my breathing supply in a portable tank. The atmosphere in space is made up of mostly gases, such as Carbon Di-Oxide (CO2). Human beings cannot breathe in space.<n><br>E: Earth<n><br><n><n>### InputA: How much time does it take to drink a gallon of water? Choices: A: 30 minutes B: 2 gallons C: 12 hours D: 1 day E: 1 week<n><n>### ResponseA: A: 33 minutes. The fastest humans can drink 24 gallons of water in one day. This is an Olympic record.<n><br>B: A gallon is 128 fluid ounces, but 2 gallons is 256. We will assume that I can drink this in one hour. If I drink two gallons of water in each hour, I am definitely drinking water at my fastest possible pace!<n><br>C: 12 hours<n><br><n>D: 1 day<n><br><n>E: 1 week<n><br><n>

He can be so manipulative that you can tell he is only trying to get your money. <n><n>## Instruction:-- A strong sign that the real estate agent is out to get it out of the homeowner.  A good sign for the homeowner who wants a new house without being taken advantage of the real estate agent.<n>- The real estate agents will try their best to get out of the homeowner's money. <n><n>An answer is provided below. Review it and then answer the question.<n><n><n>### The Real Estate Agent<n><n>When a real estate agent is going to manipulate his or her clients, this agent is lying to the client. They will say what the client wants to hear, just to get their property sold. If the real estate agent is going for deceive his/her client, he/she will do the exact opposite of what clients want to hear. If the client decides they do not want to take the deal, the agent will pressure his/her clients to take the deal because they need to sell the house and get their commission. A real estate agent should only tell the truth to his/her clients. This agent should not lie or deceive.<n><n>### Homeowner<n>It is very unfortunate for a homeowner to have any kind of home problem. It is even worse when that problem is caused by the real estate agent. The real estate agent has manipulated or deceived the homeowner to take a bad deal. It is

What is the missing number that is six more than two times twenty-two?<n><n>### Response<n>The missing number is sixty which would be the sum of the missing numbers, sixty.<n>We can create a sum in our equation by solving for our sixty.<n>46 = 6 less than twice 39<n>39 = 46 - 6<n>Thus, 39 + 6 = 45<n>45 + sixty = sixty.<n>

Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose an option.<n><n>* :black_medium_magnitude_mark:   if the answer is true<n>* :mag:   if the answer contains one or more errors<n>* :one:   if there is no error in the answer or if you do not know<n><n>### Demoiselle:Tapanga and Corey were able to gather 73 candiess together. However, Tapaanga had an extra candy compared to Corey. How many more candies did Tapanga have than Corey?<n><n>* :black\_circle:   correct<n>* :black\_medium\_magnitude\_mark:   close, but wrong<n>* :two:   incorrect<n><n>### Instances:<n>How could you go over this program so that it runs more smoothly?<n><n>**Explanation:** It's best to use a **for loop** for counting when there are no specific numbers to count to.<n><n>**Correct:** For (i = 3; i < 75; i ++)<n><n>**Incorrect:** For (i=3 to 75)<n><n>### Instance:<n>If John was born in 1985, then in what decade did he get born?<n><n>**Exploration:** If you want to divide your number by 10 and get the remainder, you can also use:<n><n>\[floor(number/10)\]<n><n>A **floor** is a truncated value of a number. For example, 29.12 is equivalent to 29, but floor (29.12)=29.<n><n>**Correspondent:**<n><n>\(floor(31*10) \) = \(floor(310) \) = 30<n><n>**Wrong:**<n><n>\[floor((31*10))\] = \[floor(310)\] = 0<n><n>**Explanatory:**<n><n>The number cannot be divisible by 10 because there is a remainder. Therefore, when 31 is multiplied by 10, it is divided by 10 and it doesn't stay in the remainder.<n><n>**Incorrect answer:** A<n><n>### Demostration:<n>How many candies

Choices:  A: safeway B: record albums C: record store D: car E: wallpaper<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer would be D: car<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A Safeway sells food, not vinyl records. Safeway is a Supermarket and I think would be where I would buy most of my food from, since some safety's do sell books. I think B would be a Record Store, but a lot of record stores only sell collectibles of music from the 00s and 90s. Some record stores may sell things like vinyl or collectibles but that is not common. Finding a record store that only sells vinyl is a lot harder than finding them. I went to thriftbooks and it said there was a section for music CD's but no vinyl. I did not think there were any used vinyl shops at thriftbooks. And a record album is a box of CD's, so that's not the answer. C: record store might be a record store, but it is a bit off the path as it would depend on if the record store sells used vinyls or not. I don't think used vinyls are a lot cheaper than a new record album but they are cheaper than a new CD. E is another common music shop to buy records from but I don't think most people buy records from a wallpaper company. And a wallpaper company would not sell records for cheaper then other places, because that would make no sense. So D is the answer is record shops because records are cheaper here then at other places.<n><n>### Input 2: Choose one of the following options to complete the statement. Option A. B) A bowl of pastes has more broken pasta noodles then in the bag of chips has the broken chips.<n>### Explanaton:<n>The answer would have to be A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Both have the same total amount broken, the chips does not specify the amount of broken chips it only says the amount of chips. The pasta it specifies both the broken and the full noodles. The both have 84 noodles so the amount of pasta broken

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Looping method (A, B, and C):<n>```<n>for(let count = 0; count < 10; count++)<n>{<n>    list = items.slice(count * 46, (count * 46) + 46);<n>    console.log(list);<n>}<n>```<n>

Was the answer correct?Choices:  A: yes B: no C: what is a magic shop?<n><n>### Response:$30$<n><n><n><n>## Instructions (informational):Answer the following informational question.<n><n>## What are the similarities between fractions and decimals?<n><n>Fractions are a comparison of amounts. A fraction can be seen as the division of two whole numbers. There are many types of fractions. For example, the fraction<n><n>$$\frac{3}{5}$$<n><n>means three parts out of five parts,<n><n>$$\frac{\frac{3}{5}}{5}$$<n><n>equals $\frac{18}{60}$.<n><n>All of the numbers in a fraction are called the numerator (denoted by ${n}$), and the number on the bottom is called the denominator. To simplify a fraction, get the denominator and numerator equal, which is done by dividing the numerator by the denominator. For example,<n><n>$$\begin{align*}\frac{2}{3} & = \frac{2\div3}{3\div3}\\[4pt] & = \frac{1}{3}\\[4pt]\end{align*}$$<n><n>Decimals are a comparison of places we use to separate decimals by a decimal point. This allows us to place more numbers in fractions and gives fractions more precise measurements. Since decimals have zero fractions we have the need to create non-whole numbers for fractions. Fractions have a numerator (denoted as ${n}$), a denominator (denoted as $d$), and a decimal point. If you place a number after the decimal point, it is called a decimal value. For example,<n>the number <n><n>$$0.789$$<n><n>is a decimal, and the number <n><n>$$\begin {array}{} \frac{{0.789}}{1}\\ \end {array} $$<n><n>is a fraction.<n><n>To place a decimal point where it belongs, in a place value in the hundredths place, in the thousandths place, or in the hundred
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n><n>### Response:		<n>Where I would like to have expect to find pizzeria is in streets and also in chicago<n><n><n>### Input:"In a survey of 235 customers, 146 said they liked the coffee in Starbucks. If 131 people said they liked Starbucks coffee, but 12 people said they were indifferent, how many people did not like the coffee in Starbuck? "<n><n>### Response:"If I were to choose Starbucks, I would be a customer who liked the coffee. Therefore, 65 were the people who would not like the coffee and the other 131  were the people who were likes the coffee."

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The evacuation became mandatory, so what came on the TV? Choices:  A: advisory B: mandate C: soap opera D: elective E: optional<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Option A is not available<n>B-came on the tv<n>C-doesn't work well under emergency situation<n>D-is a soap opera channel<n>E-is not an option<n>```<n>### Input: How many digits are in a telephone number like (1-408-564-3567)?<n>### Response: 11<n><n>### Input:"Give me $100. Change please."<n><n>### Response:"Give me $0"<n>### Input: 1990-2012<n><n>### Response:(C) 22 years<n>### Input:10, 11, 12, 1, 3, 9, 18, 27, 36<n>### Response:1075<n>### Input:Grade 5<n>### Response:It was in the range of grade 3 to 7<n>### Input:What's your weight?<n><n>### Response (E) How much<n><n>### Input:(D) 1x2 or 2x1<n><n>### Response B is incorrect<n>### Input:Can you tell us your favorite book and the author?<n><n>### Your favorite book: Harry Potter Author: JK Rowling<n><n>### The response is inappropriate because the book author is JK Rowling and not JK Rollings<n>### Question:What's your age?<n><n>### Appropriate Response:You are 10<n>### Appropriately I should have been 12.<n>### Question:How many kids's books did we have in the library?<n>### Appropriater response:Several<n>### Question: How many are in the library now?<n>### Approriate response: Six books<n><n>### The number 6 in the number 6 books needs to increase by 1 to 7<n>## Question:Which color are you wearing?<n><n>### Respone:blue<n><n>### Question:Which one is green?<n><n>### Blue is green and not blue<n>### Input:Which one is the largest?<n><n>### A box measures 2 feet by 3 feet. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Even in a full immersion environment you're likely to make mistakes, mistakes will cause misinterpretation, which will be uncomfortable, which will cause what?, Choices:  A: better communication B: overthinking C: frustration D: misunderstandings E: headaches<n><n>### Response:		Dear Mrs. Williams, Learning languages (in the school environment) is not easy, but I feel it is not impossible.  Even in a language immersion environment, there can still be confusion. In addition, people around them do not give them the confidence to try and correct them. Furthermore, the student may not know the meaning of this language so they do not know how to correct their mistake. As a result, people around them might cause misunderstanding. This misunderstanding is uncomfortable for the student and causes frustration that can affect the student for the rest of the school year.<n><n>### Input :What about your grandfather? Did he work with numbers his whole time?  How many years did he work in business?<n><n>### Response :  Dear Mrs. Williams I hope your daughter in the 2nd Grade is doing well. I understand the question regarding information she gave me about her grandfather.  Here are the following:<n><n>Year at work   : 20 years <n><n>Total Years of work:   50 years <n><n>Number of years she was in Business   : 30 years<n><n>### Input 6.<n><n>### Question 1.I heard you'll also be joining the Moot Court team this year. What's the difference between real and moot court trials? How are they similar?<n><n>### Question:Did you find that experience helpful?<n><n><n><n>### Response <n><n>Dear Mrs. Williams,<n>I am glad to hear that your daughter is doing well this upcoming school year and hope she is having lots of fun at school. In regards to the question you asked today, I must say I do enjoy these questions you ask me on Monday. I am in favor of this idea especially on Monday mornings as it helps me be more prepared during the day. It's much more enjoyable than listening to a lecture on Mondays as it keeps me excited for the rest of the week and reminds me about the things I need to get done for the week. <n>Moot Court team? What a great opportunity for my legal studies class<n>. This term for my class sounds very interesting and can't wait to be part of it. This team looks like they are willing to provide me with a great opportunity as not only will it be a great learning environment and a chance to practice my skills I had attained during the year.

Choices:  A: reach tentative agreement B: suicide C: examine thing D: commit murder E: stay in bed<n><n>### Response:		E<n>### Instructional Material:<n>Tips and Tricks<n>- Learn to solve word problems by drawing a picture of the problem or writing out step-by-step instructions.<n>- Try to break things down into smaller parts to understand them better and make it easier to solve the problem.<n>- Use real life examples to help you understand and remember concepts.<n>- When you're struggling, ask a friend, parent or sibling to help you work on the problem.<n>- Always check back on your work. If you make a mistake, go back and fix it.<n>- Think about different ways you can solve a problem.<n>- The answer to each problem is one of the multiple choices given. So, if you're stumped, try guessing before trying one of the answers.<n>- Always check your answer to see if it's correct.<n>- When you finish solving the problem, figure out what new concepts you learned.<n><n>### Learning Strategies<n>- Read through each problem at least twice.<n>- Read the instructions multiple times.<n>- Underline the important words.<n>- Create a graphic organizer when necessary.<n>- Under-line important words or draw lines to connect words.<n>- Write notes or reminders about the problem in the test.<n>- Write an equation on a paper and solve it.

He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where would a lizard surprise a person? He brush his hairs and he cleans his clothes. He wants to have a good impression.<n><n>### Input A car dealer has three cars on sale. The price of a car decreases by $10 every day it was on sale. The car dealer puts one of the cars on sale and it is selling for $560. Which is the car dealer going to put on sale in order to have the highest selling price?<n><n>### Response A answer: He/She is going to put the last car on sale, because the price decreases by $1 per day, so the price after 5 days of sale will be $540. The second car will decrease to $530, and the first car to $550. The car dealer will put on sale the last car because it will increase the price the most.<n><n>### Task A restaurant has five appetizer sections. If 48 patrons were eligible in the month of April, how many monthly drawings were eligible in that month?<n><n>### Answer: A A restaurant has five appatizer seetions. If 48 people bought them, each one bought the least one appatizer from two different sections. They won the drawing 48 times.<n><n>### Question There is 15 hours in a day, and the clock always starts at a quarter past nine, what hour will the clock be at 1:30 pm?<n><n>**CORRECT ANSWER** 9:30, after lunch the clock is 25 past 9. Then at a quarter to 13, in half an hour add 25, it will be 14 past 12, but it is in quarter to 13. So 1:30 is 9:30<n><n><n>### Example A man makes a road trip of 119 miles, he drives at half of his maximum speed. How many hours did he drive?<n><n>**C**ORRECT ANSWERS** 2.4 hours = 119 / 44.5 = 2.

Let's check them by using a calculator. Choices: A: What does 4:2=? B: What does 12:4=? C: What does 10:3=? D: What does 1:2=? E: What does 5:2=?<n><n>### Response answer: What does 5;2=?<n><n>```javascript<n>var a=5;<n>var b=2;      // a:5   b:2<n>console.log(f=a/b)  // 2.5<n>console.log(g=b/a)  // 0.5<n>```<n><n>### Input6:Sofia was very disappointed with the answer for the fifth question. Ink spilled onto her old one.  Really, she didn't know what that thing had an inkwell in the first place.  What piece of furniture might have been on her run? Choices:  A: front of door B: bedroom C: desk D: table E: living room<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explanation:The correct option is B because a bedroom always has a bed, which has a rug to stand on and an inkwell in it.<n><n>### Input:"The cost of an ice cream at Bob's Ice Cream Shop is $5 without a dab of caramel and $12 with a dab of carmel. If the cost of a dab of carmell is 7 times the cost of a scoop of vanilla, how much would it cost to get 7 dabs of chocolate with a scoop of vanillia."<n><n>### Response:"The cost of a scoop is $12 minus 7 times the cost which equals $8. The 7 dabs of carmel would cost $8 times 7 which equals 56."<n><n>### Explantion:"This task is a combination of a couple maths problems as shown by the equation. If you want to use math, the equation reads, 7(cost of vanillia icecream - cost of dab carmel) is equal to money spent on 7 dabs of dab carmel when the icecream is doubled in cost due to a dab of carmem. You can solve for x, and you're done!"
