A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to stand at an intersection? Choices:  A: cars B: city street C: street corner D: fork in road E: at a red light<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: A<n><n>### Input and Response:<n><n>Input and Response:<n>Austin has 31 apples.  He gives 8 apples to his neighbors.  How many apples does Austin have left?<n>Input:<n>Austin's neighbor left 5 apples, and he has 7 apples remaining.<n>Response:<n>Austin now has 4 apples.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:John moved away from his family.  He was a bit upset that he had to do it, but he needed the job.  Still, he would have preferred it if the job were what? Choices:  A: present B: stay here C: closer D: available E: come here<n><n>### Response:		D <n><n>### Instructor Comment:A [present] is something that is given to show that something is a special time. It is also something that you could keep with you in a special place to think about or remember that special time. Something could be a [stay] when you do not move in location, but keep the same job and/or residence. Something could be [closer] when it is in an area that is near where you are already located to make it less of a physical or logistical inconvenience. Finally, something could be [available] when it is open to someone to get it. Something could also be available when something has potential of being gotten. You can get more things to help you by looking them up in a dictionary. 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: study french cooking C: taste sauce D: prepare food E: thin sauce<n><n>### Response:		If the chef is cooking french cooking, then what will the chef taste? Also, if the chef is tasting sauce, then what is the chef cooking?<n><n>### Input:[1, 2, 3, 5] A: number of candies B: number of candies C: the highest value D: the highest value<n><n>### Response:[1, 2]<n><n>```<n>[1, 2, [1].map(c => c + [].map(c2 => c + -1)), 11<n>[1] -> 1<n>[2, 1] -> 2<n>[19, 10, 17] -> 21<n>[2, [1, 1, 3], 10] -> 13<n>[3] -> 3<n>[4, 1, 1, [1], 6] -> 12<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:After his mother saw his report card he knew he was going to be doing housework, what could have prevented this? Choices:  A: sneezing B: fatigue C: house clean D: feeling satisfied E: getting good grades<n><n>### Response:		After his report card came in he knew he was going do housework and he was not sure if he was going to prevent himself from doing his house chores. He did not know why he was not going to perform his house chores since he got high marks. He sneezed too much so he may not perform the house work and get sick. Fatigue was also an issue, he needs to get enough sleep and rest in order to perform the house work on time. His mom and dad got mad, so he just did not felt satisfied.<n><n>### Credit(s):<n><n>[Reference](https://github.com/thi-ng/umbrella-services)<n><n>### Link(s):<n>[Source](https://github.community/articles/the-best-way-to-describe-a-task-is-a-task-story)

Choices:  A: notoriety B: emotional distress C: riot D: bad dreams E: annoyance<n><n>### Response:		Answer C. Emotional distress.<n><n>Example:<n>Michael tells 100 people about getting a parking ticket due to driving too far and in the wrong direction. They tell everyone they can think of. He’s in trouble now.<n><n>### Input What will telling many people about a happy secret lead to? Choices A: notoriety, B: emotional distrust C: riot D E: Annoyance<n><n>## Response: Answer D. Annoyance<n>Example: Michelle tells her parents and friends about her new boyfriend. They are happy for her, but it gets around school and people start teasing her about it. Everyone knows and talks about it. She wants to tell them it’s not a big deal, but they don’t stop. Everyone is in Michelle’s business. She doesn’t really want to share, but she can’t stop everyone from talking about it.<n><n>### Answer: What will telling many people that you feel like you’re on another planet lead to? Choice A. Notoriety B. Emotional distrust C. Riot D. Annoyances<n><n><n>### Response D. Annoyancy<n><n>### Input. What will not telling someone how to solve a problem do?<n><n>### Response C. If you tell everyone else you don’t want to talk about the problem and get annoyed.<n><n>### Response B. Make sure the other person doesn’t get stuck in what they’re doing.<n><n>###Input. What will not asking for help doing something difficult? Choice A: notoriety <n>### Response C: Notoriety. <n><n>### What will not asking for people’s opinions do? Choices: A: Cause a riot B: Emotional distress C: notoriety.<n>### Response B: Cause a riots. Example: <n>### Input. When you are not nice to someone, they will think about you with _____. Choices: A: notoriety; B: Emotional trust<n>### Response A: Notoriety. Example: <n><n>### Input<n>When you tell all your friends how to do a math question, you will ______. Choices A: cause a riot B: emotional distraught C:

A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Choices:  A: bike B: downtown C: building D: tool storage E: car<n><n>### Response:		garage is correct<n><n>### Input : James bought a garage. He has a bike, downtown, building, and tool storage. Which item does not fit inside a garage? Choices: A: bike B C D E<n><n>### Response : tool storage is correct<n><n>## Instruction:Write three different sentences or questions in which the pronoun subject and object each refer to the noun subject.<n><n>### Response Example: The cat sat at the table. She is a good cat.<n><n>### Input Example: Tanner is my best friend.<n>### Response Example<n><n>### A. It's me who is Tanner's best friend.<n><n>### B. It's me that is Tanner's friend.<n><n>## Auxiliary verbs Exercise<n><n>### Input Exercise:Fill in the blanks below by choosing the correct answer. The subject of each sentence is boldfaced.<n>1. Therefore, it is not true that the expression of pain is "laughter".<n><n>### Comments<n><n>Comment: The problem with this one is the question's use of "show", which can just as easily mean "show to the public". Since the person is in pain when she is emotionally embarrassed, this is also a false.<n><n>### Exercise<n><n>### Explore Examples<n><n>### Feedback<n><n>### Input Examples:<n><n>### Response Examples:<n><n>```python<n>Emotion: pain<n>Emotion: laughter<n>```<n>### Feedforward Examples:<n><n><n>### Feature Engineering<n><n>### Train<n>

For example with 6 students we can get combinations: 2, 1,4,3,5,6 or 1,5,2,6,3,4. If the student sings the song there is a 33% chance of winning, and if the student doesn't sing then there is a 66% chance of winning. When asked to sing or not, there is also 50% chance that the student will sing or will not

"Loan" is being used incorrectly. Borrow describes the action of taking something and putting it in your possession to benefit from it or use it. However, loan is the action of giving something to someone or an organization that is expecting to get the same thing back later.<n><n>### Response:"Borrow"<n><n>### A: There are 57 apples to a box.<n><n>### B: There are 53 oranges to a box.<n>

Choices:  A: happiness B: pleasure C: happy D: grief E: isolation<n><n>### Response:		<n>B, Happy<n><n>**Note:**<n>Answer choices (A), (B), (C) and (D) are incorrect.<n>Answer choice (E) is not provided in the question.<n><n>## Explanation:<n>In this question we need to decide on the feeling of a person that has a wife that is unhappy of their marriage<n><n>**Note: Choice (A)** states that when someone is unhappy of their relationship then the person will feel happy. However, this is incorrect as they state their wife wants to be unhappy in their marriage, which would mean a person would be unhappy with their marriage and this happiness is based on the fact that they are happy that they have a partner willing to live the rest of their lives unhappy within the relationship. This means that the person would not be happy as they had to put up with it.<n><n>**Note:Choice (B)** indicates that as the wife is unhappy of their marrige, when the husband is unhappy of their wife they would be in pleasure. Based on this, a husband will not likely be in pleasure with their wife as the wife wants to be unhappily married to them. Thus, when they are married, they are unhappy and this then has to put them in displeasure<n><n>**Note:Choices (C) & (D)** are incorrect, as the feelings do not fit based on the context of the question.<n><n>**Note**: Choice (E) is not indicated in the question.<n>

After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is choice A, <n>Based on the instruction and previous exercises,  the answer is A.<n><n>**Instruction:** <n>An apple tree stands close to a group of trees in the woods. They are surrounded by lots of trees. The town is named after an apple tree. We can also say the apple tree is in Illinois.<n><n><n><img src="https://github.com/thuongdai3551/Thuong-Dai-Dang-Dalat/blob/master/Pictures/A.jpg" width="150"><n><img src="Pictures/B.jpg"  width="150"/><n><img src="Images/C.jpg" width="200"/><n><img  src="Pictures/D.jpg"  width=150>><n><img src="AJ.jpg" width=" 200" /> <img src="images/E.jpg" width =150/><n><n><n><n>**Exercise:**<n>A few years ago, I picked some apples from an apple tree in New York. I ate some of them. I asked someone in New York what the name of the town where the apple tree was. He called it a "farmers' market."<n><n><img src='https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23252818/41376785-f61a9b8a-733b-11e8-8ff6-7dd2767de2b3.png' width='200' height='300'><n><img src='../../Images/C.GIF' width='20'/><n><n><n>**Feedback:** <n>For your next exercise, be sure to provide an input and outputs.<n><n>

'); <n>```<n><n>## Input/Response<n>How many people did the Mayflower carry?<n>```JavaScript 	<n>var answer = 106;<n>var passPortCount = parseInt(prompts('How many passengers were on the Mayflower?'));<n>```<n>### Response<n>Pilgrims, that's who. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where does a person need to get when they have more kids? Choices:  A: compliments B: understand themselves C: life partner D: second chances E: larger house<n><n>### Response:		**A**<n><n>### Input::What animal has no legs?<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Riding bike through rough terrain can be dangerous, one could find themselves what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: accident C: get somewhere D: hurt E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Demonstion:<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input<n>Sonia sold 6 t-shirts for $28 each at a bounce house festival in town, 3 hats for $10 each at the bounce house festival, and 8 socks for $8/pair. How much money did Sonia make?<n>A. $75<n>B. $80<n>C. $93<n>D. $112<n><n>### Demosrative:<n><n>### Detailed Instructions:<n><n>### Demowstration:<n><n>## Input<n>The sun is 93,000,000 miles from the Earth. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What does a virus primarily do to a person? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. Viruses can be defined as a microorganism that has the ability to infect living host cells and survive and replicate within them. They can be divided into two main forms; viruses that attack animals and viruses that can attack bacterium.<n><n>Infectious viruses can be characterized by their ability to multiply or replicate within living organism. After infecting a victim, they enter the host cell and begin to replicate.<n><n>The virus is the only microorganism that can infect the animal and plants as these are the two living host cells that can be attacked from the inside of the living cell and eventually reproduce. Viruses can survive by attacking the host cell's structure and alter its normal functioning, they are paradoxical organism that cause infections in its host cell.<n><n>Replication includes  the processes they follow inside the cell, including the processes of copying their genetic material. They do not have their own metabolism making them extremely simple organisms.<n><n>They are responsible for infections as they attack their host cell or virus causing a variety of severe or mild illnesses. Some of the viruses affecting the human beings are influenza, human immunodeficiency virus, the common cold, Epstein-Barr virus, and varicella-zoster virus.<n><n>Other sources also provide information that is related.<n><n>Replication can be understood in the way they produce copies of themselves during reproduction. It can be understood in terms of their mode of attachment in the host cell and the process of budding after the cell division.<n><n>In the process of replicating the virus copies, they do not have a nutrient source. This means that they need help from the cell in which they are reproduced in order to survive.<n><n>Some viruses can be transferred as infectious entities in nature by contact from an infected person to another or from an infected animal or insect to another.<n><n>The primary role of the viruses, being reproduced in infected living host cells, is to produce copies or multiply themselves inside those cells.<n><n>The virus begins replicating, and as it grows and gets bigger inside the host cell, it can also mutate and evolve. Eventually, its membrane is damaged by the new virus particles created.<n><n>### Input:-A:<n>T

Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n><n>### Response:		A: Bee hive  B: United Kingdom<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You can create 1 to 3 tasks of this type for every student in your class.<n><n>How do I create a task?<n><n>Create a task in the Students tool. A task is a digital resource to be used as an assessment for all members of a student group, or for an individual student.<n><n>### Creation Process:<n>For a group, select the group when prompted to select groups to assign to a task. The group will be the default group assigned to the task.<n><n>### Note:<n>If you are changing the due date for a task, be sure to change the due date for each student's copy of the task.<n><n>Changing a task's name, title, or description does not actually change the assignment for the student.<n><n>To ensure that the task is available immediately for each student:<n><n>1. Copy the class and change the due date<n>2. Create a class copy by clicking Duplicate<n><n><n>----<n>Copyright (c) 2002-2009 Houghton Mifflin Harcourt Publishing Company. All rights reserved.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:In the movie a fragile man is causing accidents, his hope is to find a person opposite of him who is what? Choices:  A: undestroyable B: unbreakable C: indestructible D: durable E: invisible<n><n>### Response:		A) undestroyable<n>In this situation, he could only be undestroyable, he could get destroyed eventually but there's nothing that he finds that could destroy him.<n><n>### Input:"This will be the day of world peace.""All this day long.""All day long."What type of sentence is it?" Choice:  A: an exclamation B: an exuberant C: a declarative D: a narrative<n><n>### Response:"This will be the best ever and nobody could be happier, this will be so happy and for all world peace!"<n>Declarative this one.<n><n>### "If you go 1 dollar to 2 dollar. If you go to 2 to 4, and so on, you increase a factor." What math operation is it? Choices: A: multiplication B: division C: addition D: subtraction E: percentage <n><n>### Response" If you go to 1 to 4, that's four times more!"<n>Division<n><n>### Inst: "Alice was 8, and she ate 1/3rd of all of the fruit. She then made 6 more muffins and 4 pies." What fraction of bread did Alice make?<n><n>### Response 1/4<n>There's a quarter and a third. Alice made one third and she made six more muffins and four more pies. So she had 1/4 of bread.<n><n>### This is why our planet is dying," the narrator says. "Every single person, it is your responsibility to save the earth." What word tells us that we need to act? Choices: A. cause B. impact C. need D. obligation E. opportunity<n><n>### Response The narrator said:"this is why our planet is dieing" and the use of Cause, impact, Need, Obligation and Opportunity are the same meaning word because they're all about taking action, and they are all about doing something because of an action that has already been done.<n><n>### I've never been a dog person," Lina said. "I much prefer rats." What word explains why Lina prefers rats? Choices: A."person" B."prefer" C. ".rats." D. ".dog"<n>-L

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Which of the following statements are NOT true? Choices: A: You pay $49 for an item with a purchase price of $60, and you receive a 20% (or $5 in this case) discount. B: You pay $52 for an item with a price of $65, and you receive a discount of more than 20% (because 65–52 = 13 > 0.2(65–52) = 4.67). C: You pay $64 for an item with a discount of over 20% (i.e., 20% (64/60)= 32% discount, so $64 > 5(64/60) = $14). If you pay over $60, the discount rate is higher. D: You pay $5.17 for an item with a 20% off discount (5.17 = (49/24)× 20, use the formula 100 x (price-discount) and take 20% of price and multiply that by 20).<n><n>Answer:<n>Input #5:<n>Input #6:<n>Input #7:<n>Input #8:<n><n>### Democrat:<n>- It doesn’t matter if it’s an even or an odd number<n>- The discount doesn’t apply to products less than $50.01<n>- The discount rate is higher for those under $60<n><n>### Instructor:<n>It doesn’t matter if the item’s price is a multiple of $5, and the maximum discount rate is 20%.<n><n>### Instict:<n>Answer a:

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. B+D = 95<n><n>### InputInput: Which number would be added to 2 8 to make 9? Choices: A: 0 B: 1 C: 2 D: 5 E: 6<n><n>### ResponseI will use PE MD AS rule to solve.<n><n>245<n><n>### Reference:<n><n>[PEMDAS Rule](https://math.ucsd.edu/~christopher/5c/notes/notes55.pdf)

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A gentleman is very wealthy and flaunts it, where does he likely live? Choices:  A: europe B: big house C: tuxedo D: palace E: men's room<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: he lives in a palace<n>

Choices:  a: it is efficient b: good for memory c: good for thinking d: easy<n><n>**Answer:**<n><n>### Instructions<n>In this task, you will respond to text containing a blank, by filling out the blank with a missing word from the options provided.  <n><n>### Input<n>The text below has one blank in bold.  Choose only the answer that is a missing pronoun or a missing article for the blank with the correct article or pronoun.  (For example, if the article is a missing "a", then please select only the answer with "a".)<n><n>### Example (Answer)<n>The  girl that ____<n>	<n>**Same:**<n>The girl who <n><n>### Answer:	The<n><n>### Input (Task Description)<n>The text below has five questions with a blank in bold.  In each text, answer only the question with the correct pronoun or article for the blank.<n><n>### Example<n>Fill in the blank:<n>```java<n>The girl that ______ has an interesting story to tell.<n>   	Girl A B C D None of these<n>```<n>### Example (answer)<n>```java<n>The ______ girl has the best story of the five.<n>```<n>### Answer:<n>	B<n><n>### Input <n><n>The text below has a blank in bold. Use only the words provided to fill in the blank.<n><n>Example text<n>```<n>the ____ who lives <n>```<n><n>### Example answer<n>```<n>in an apartment <n>```<n><n>	| Example Answer | Question Mark | <n>| --- | --- | --- |<n>| the girl. who | |<n>| the girl?. who | |<n>|  |<n><n>### Answer Question:	the<n><n>### Instructin<n>In this task, describe an object that matches the picture provided. Choices:  A: raise corn B: seed plants C: grow plants D: seed crops E: farm land<n><n>### Response:		<n>Plants (C) seed plants.<n><n>### Input & Response:<n><n>Input: This one is confusing. Input: The farmer chose plants he (I) chose plants he(A) could make bird feed from. Use of (C) again the next year, (E) chose plants he could make (E) bird feed from and use (E) of again the next year. Choices (B): (A), (D), (D)<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Please check your work and try to learn the following:<n><n>1. There will be some tasks that will involve solving an inequality.<n>2. There will be some problems that involve a system of equations.<n>3. There will be some simple algebra problems.<n><n>### Your Input:<n><n>Input: The farmer (A) I (I) chose plants (A) he (B) he chose plants (A) I (C) chose plants he (A) could make bird (A) feed from (D) and use of (E) again the (C) next year. Choices:  A: aquarium B: mediterranean sea C: south pacific D: pool hall E: pacific ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demostration<n>```js<n>const aquarium = 'A';<n><n>if (aquarium === 'A') {<n>	 console.log(`you are playing with a Shark in an Aquarium`);<n>} else if (aquarium === 'B') {<n>	 console.log(`you are playing by the mediterrian`);<n>} else {<n>	 console.LOG(`i dont understand any of the answers`);<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Response<n>`I don't understand any of the answers. But if I had to guess it was a pool hall.`<n><n>### Instructions:You are asked to write a method that takes an input string and return the capitalized version of the input string.<n><n>### Methods:Write a method that will take the input string as a parameter and after returning the capitalized input string, return the string and the number of characters that were capitalized.<n><n>### Code:<n>```js<n>const capitalize = (string) => {<n>  return string;<n>}<n><n>console.log(capitalize (`hii`))<n>```<n><n>## Instructions:What do you expect for the value of console.log(capitalized (`hii`))?<n><n>## Assumptions:<n>The `string` parameter is 3 characters long and has upper case letters, and <n>lower case letters.<n><n>## Demonstration:1. If I had to guess the capitilized version (`HI`) will be returned by the console.<n>2. In addition to this I will log the number of capital letters in that capitalized string (`2`).<n><n>### Assumptions:Consider a situation where you need to write a function that returns the capitalized form of a given string.<n><n>## Solutions:<n><n>```js<n>const string = "hi"<n><n>function getCapitalizedString(string) {<n>  return string[0].toUpperCase() + string.slice(1).toLowerCase().replace(/\w/g, function(letter) {<n>    return letter.toUpperCase();<n>  })<n>}<n>  <n>console.log(getCapitalizedString(name))<n>```<n>

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Choices:  A: drill B: learn C: require obedience D: understand E: spoon<n><n>### Response:		Choices: C: require obedienced A: drill Bspoon E: spoon A: drill<n><n>### Explanation:Carpenters work wood to meet their clients' specifications. They are trained to use a wide range of tools that shape and cut wood. A hammer and chisel, a drill and drill bits, and a saw and file are some things that a carpenter may use to build a piece of furniture to specifications. They may also require clients to obey building codes and adhere to building laws. A woodworker may require clients to understand the basics of working with wood. While carpenters focus on finishing projects with materials, they also pay attention to the size, type, and texture of the surfaces they are working with. They may use a variety of tools, such as a pencil with an eraser, to make the work more precise. Woodworkers may also be instructed to use other materials, such as spikes, screws, and chisels to complete projects. Woodworking is a process that requires dedication and practice. It requires a certain degree of dedication to finish projects. It also requires a great amount of detail to be exact. For example, a small-scale project may require a hammer and a chisel, while an enormous project may require a large amount of expertise and knowledge. In addition, carpenters may be required to use spoon for a range of tasks. While they may have to be skilled in cutting boards, painting, and assembling furniture, they may be required to be knowledgeable about installing windows, building garages, and making furniture. When woodworking, carpenters may also be required to obey building codes and understand the terms of a contract. While carpenters have to be skilled at understanding how to build a project, they may also be required to be knowledge about working with tools. In addition, woodworkers may also have to have access to a variety of tools, including screws, screws, chisels, and hammers. While a carpenter may not be required to have a degree in woodworking, woodworkers may be required to be skilled in a range of techniques and tools.<n><n>### Input :What are the ingredients to make a delicious pizza?Choices: A: tomato B: sauce C

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n>Changing society using a conflict is know as an action. Violence means a physical and sometimes violent force.<n>### Input: What's your favorite activity to do in my room? Choices:  a: study anatomy b: study history c: listen to music d: play games e: play ping-pong f: help on homework<n><n>### Response<n>B<n>Your favorite activity to do in My Room is listening to music.<n>### Input (B): My uncle has 50% of my dad's income. My dad gets a salary of $28000 a year. My uncle also has $12000. I found the total to be $12.50. Who is right between you and the bus driver?<n>### Answer: <n>C<n>The bus driver is right. His answer of $12.45 (or $12.40 or $12.43, or any other number where $12.47 is strictly smaller) is correct because I multiplied the answer by 100 instead of 1000. This made the decimal point of my answer be placed at the right hand side instead of the left hand side.<n><n>###Input  (D): After I cleaned my table, I was able to finish my homework much faster. What statement best defines Causation? Choices: A: A is caused by B B: B is caused by A C: C is caused by D D: No relation between A and  B<n><n>### Answer<n>A<n>B is caused by A because when I finished cleaning my table, I was then able to finish my home work after cleaning the dinner dishes.<n><n>### Input (E): How to avoid bacteria in raw meat? How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. Write the response with the correct outcome.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input: TAPANGA AND COREY HAVE 66 CANDY TOGETHER. HOWEVER, TAPANGA HAS 8 MORE CANDY THAN COREY. HOW MANY CANDY DOES COREY HAVY?<n><n>### Demnstration:<n>Input contains 2 different objects and it wants to show how many candies Corey has.<n><n>### Response<n>How many do Corey have?<n><n>### Example<n>Input:FREDDIE IS CALLING HIS FAMILY ON NEW YEAR'S EVE. HE CALLS HIS DAD, WHO LIVES IN THE SAME CITY AS HIM, AND THEY TALK FOR 45 MINUTES. THEN HE CALLS HIM BROTHER, WHO LIVED ON THE OTHERSIDE OF THE WORLD, AND THEY TAKE FOR 31 MINUTES. LOCAL CALLS COST 5 CENTS A MINUTE, WHILE INTERNATIONAL CALLS CUT 25 CENTS A  MINUTE. HOW MANNY DOLLERS DID FREDDIE SPEND CALLING HIS FAMELY ON NEW YEAR'SS EAVE?<n><n>### Question:<n>How many dollars did Freddy spent calling his family on New year's Eve? And it asks for the total sum of all the calls he makes.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Output:<n><n>### Response Example<n>How many dollars did he spend calling his family on new year's eve?<n><n>### Answer<n>10 dollars.<n><n>### Note:<n>Note that for 3,5,6, and 7 you should use the same structure as 1 and 2. This is because there will always be an issue after you apply the operation for both integers. The task will state both variables before solving.<n><n>## [ ] Create a script for the task request is answered using a demonstration.<n><n>### Notes:<n>Note that you should not use

I prefer the home vacation too, but it has less benefits as a oversea vacation, such as not learning something new, not know about foreign language and culture and not gain new friends. I think oversea vacation helps us to know how life is like in other countries. Find the mean of the distribution.<n>2. Find the standard deviation of the distribution.<n>3. Calculate the median of the distribution.<n>4. Find the mode of the distribution.<n><n>### Response to the above question<n>> 1) The mean of the distribution = -5.51 <br> 2) The standard deviation of the distribution = 2.79 <br> 3) The median of the distribution = A. 9, B: 3, C: 50, D: 400 <br> 4) The mode of the distribution = A: 4,B. 6, C: 12, D: 20<n><n>## Examples of correct responses<n>```<n>> Input: 2105<n>> Output: Density function: F(x) = 1/5*((95190 - sqrt(62,356)*x + 143  )/(62,357*sqrt(62,327*.51)*x - 0.51*sqrt(269,250.5)*x + 1.52

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Shane was supposed to speak at his fathers funeral.  He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		Correct, this is a question to check your understanding of how to approach a code golfing problem.<n><n>### Answer to the above question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>For example, the following code would work for:<n><n>Input: A large number N that is divisible by 5 and 13. What is the remainder?<n><n>Output: 1<n><n>Input: A small number N that is divisibble by 5 and 6. What is the remainder, if any?<n><n>Output: Nothing<n><n>### Answer:<n>Sometimes the question you're being asked seems like it could be answered using a for loop, a while loop, a do while loop, or maybe using multiple loops. But for code golf, we have to use only one of these and it needs to be the fastest.<n><n><n>### Demos:<n>Examples:<n>**For loops:**<n><n>Input: There is a house with 10 bedrooms each with 15 pillows in it. How many pillows are there in total if we count every pillow?<n><n>Output: There is a house that has 10 bedrooms and each of those have 15 pillows. There are a total of 10*15 pillows in the house.<n><n>**While loops:**<n><n>- Input : A man needs to water his garden. There were 3 plants that needed watering and each are 5 feet apart. How many feet did the man walk back and forth to water the garden?<n>- Output: A man needs to water the garden. There are 3 plants that are 5 feet apart and the man must water each plant. The man walks back and forth from the first plant, then he plants a little further and water the next plant. This is repeated 3 times.<n>- Solutiton<n>- 75 feet = 5 feet * 15 steps.<n>  <n>**Do/while loops:**<n><n>In the while loop, the condition is checked and if it is false, the program exits. A do/while does not do this. The do/while loop checks the condition at the beginning and then does the statement after the while loop. But this while loop, I would just use:<n><n>```javascript<n><n>do {<n>    if (condition) {}<n> }while(condition)<n><n>```<n>

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. I can buy bread from the bakery and then make a sandwich at home. | E(x)=bread(bakery)+(S(X))|<n><n>| 2. I can buy food at the nearby market. I need to pay $1 more than the number of miles from home.| F(x)=X+1|<n><n>| 3. I can also buy a sandwich at the convenience store for $2.50. | F+(X)?|<n><n>| 5. There are 232 students at the high school. When someone walks into a coding interview I'm wearing a suit and tie and I'm always using a laptop. It's also a good idea to smile if it is an online interview. Coding is hard and a lot more people give up that what you think, so give yourself an advantage! Smiling and having a good initial impression can help with that!<n>* Hint 3: I've been in a lot of interviews and have used various websites to write interview problems. I'm familiar with the codeandtext.com site and it has very good interview problems. There is a good example on how the site works here: https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.linkedin.com/amp/pulse/how-use-c0de-and-text-write-better-interview-questions-cameron-taylor/ If you are able to ask good questions without needing codeandtext.com that is great, interviewers are impressed when people can write good questions and they're probably not familiar with the site.<n>* Hint #4: My name is Cameron and not Camaron. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What do customers do in a store? Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A, B, D, E<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>* A) hunt: Customers walk around a store to find what they want to buy.<n>* B) pay merchants with (money:) Customers go up to the cashier and pay using money.<n>* D) demand satisfaction: Customers demand products to be sold in the store.<n>* E) spend money: Customers spend their money to buy products in the store.<n><n>### Input:"Rancho has three children: Shakira, Cindy and Shalane. Cindy and Shakira play volleyball. Shakira's favorite color is blue while Shalane's favorite color is red. Cindy's favorite color is pink. Why does Rancho have one fewer daughter than son?"<n><n>### Response:"Rancho has one fewer daughter than son because Cindy is a daughter and Shakira and Shalane are sons."<n><n>### Reasons:<n><n>* Volleyball means sports.<n>* Cindy is a female meaning daughter while Shakira and Shane are male so they are sons.<n><n>### Credits to the original post by:<n>```https://www.interviewbit.com/problems/how-many-candies-does-corey-have/```

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? Choices:  A: airplane B: ship's hold C: boat D: truck E: train<n><n>### Response:		Boat's hold<n>### Input:A boy has a kite. He wants to fly the kite but he doesn't know which way to blow to make it fly. So, he goes and asks other people how to fly the kite. The first person he asks doesn't know how to fly the kites at all, so he doesn't know the answer. The second person he asks tells him to blow toward the line to make it go up. The third person explains how to fly the kit for you but the boy is running away while listening. Once the boy is about 5 yards away he asks the third person again, but he walks so slow that it takes him an hour to reach the kid. How much time have passed from when he asked the second person until when he asked the third person on?<n>### Response: 33 minutes<n><n>### Instructions: How many people will have the last seat if there are 18 passengers on a trip and the last seat only costs $10 more than the first? [A,B,C,D]<n>2. [F,E,C](E)<n><n>1. [A]<n>2. [E]<n><n>1. [F,D]<n>2.[A,C]<n><n>1. A<n>2. [F]<n><n>1. B<n><n>1. E<n><n>1. [D](F)<n>2. [B,D]<n>3. [A,C]<n>

Choices:  A: meet people B: meet friend C: make people laugh D: socialize E: liquor<n><n>### Response:		<n>If someone is feeling lonely he should find someone to hang out with and hang out with that person as often as he can.<n><n>The input question asks about loneliness. It says that you should make friends when you feel lonely. In order to figure out the most appropriate response, it is very important to understand the context. It is obvious that the context is when a person is feeling lonely.<n><n>Loneliness can be felt due to many reasons. One of these reasons is missing friends and family. Therefore, the appropriate response is to call or hang out with them.<n><n>One can hang out with people that he misses by meeting people. This action might make a person less lonely, because when people are around they can talk freely and have fun with others. When a person has fun with them he also becomes happier and thus loneliness is less felt.<n><n>The input does not give enough details to come to a clear conclusion for selecting other possible answers.<n><n><n>Expected response: meet people<n>Actual response: A is given as the correct answer. Meet people should have been selected as the correct answer, because it is the only answer that makes sense in the context and can be selected based on common knowledge.<n>Thus meet people should be the chosen answer.<n><n>### Input :<n>Derek has 20 dollars; 30 minutes ago, he purchased a new MP3 player for 64 dollars; 5 minutes later he bought a pair of jeans for 12 dollars; how many minutes did he have left before he reached 64 dollars?<n><n>Expected response :<n>You need to figure out the remaining time since you already know how much money remained.<n>The given answer is 5:20, when the time should be 5:25.<n><n>The solution is written by: <n><n>Randolph B<n><n>The difficulty of the solution is:<n><n>Medium<n>

An apple is passed around each time a new boy joins the line, and then it starts over with the first boy in the line. How many apples are in the line when there is only one boy left?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>If we subtract 35 from 4 x the number of Apples(40),we will get 4. The new boy will have an apple and there will be 36 apples in the line.<n><n>### Response : There are 35 apples in the line if there is one boy left.<n><n>### Example: One day, David woke up to find 5 bananas, 2 apples, and 1 orange in his bathroom; he ate one banana, two apples, and half an orange. After he ate, he found that he had 2 bananas, 4 apples, and 2 1/2 oranges left. How many appes were there originally?<n><n>Solution:<n><n>Because the number of Banana,apples and orange are respectively in increasing order,so the total numbers of fruit should be in descending order.<n>So total number of fruits were 10.<n><n>Because he ate one banna, two apples that means now there would be 10 left. <n>So it becomes 9 + 10 = 19<n><n><n>So total number of fruit left 3. and half of it is still 2 apples.<n><n>So 10 - 3 = 7<n><n><n>So total apples are 2.and one of it is cut into half.So one apple is left.<n><n><n>### Example 2: Five pairs of socks were hung on a line. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What eastern state is home to a mountain? However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If I need deodorant, where do I go to but some? In a wedding they would be the bride and groom and the people they choose. In a church, they'd be the leaders of the church.<n><n>

Choices:  A: relax B: dreams C: have nightmares D: restlessness E: snore<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: relax<n><n>**Input Language Format:** The user will input in response to the question.<n><n>**Input Language Response Example:** A: relax<n><n>**Output Format:** Display the response.<n><n>**Output Language Syntax:** Output.Print(choice)<n><n>### Program<n>The program should first allow the user to input their response. Then, it should check to see if their response was an appropriate answer. The following are the rules the program should follow, if the user's answer is incorrect.  <n>The program should ask the user for a new answer.  <n>The program will keep asking the user for a new response until it is correct.<n><n>### Sample Input<n><n>Input: What prevents someone from getting sleep?<n>Answer: relax<n><n>Input: What is the best way to relieve stress?<n>Answer: exercise<n><n>Input: What time is it?<n>Answer: 7 o'clock<n><n>Input: How many cups of coffee do you drink in a day?<n>Response: I drink four<n><n>### Sample Output<n><n>#### The correct answer is:<n>[relax, exercise, 7:00, I drink four cups of coffee]<n><n>The input of "relax" is the correct answer.<n><n>#### The following answer is incorrect:<n>[relax, four cups of coffee, I drink four]<n><n>The incorrect answer is "four cups of coffee."<n><n>#### The following answers are incorrect:<n>[relax]<n><n>The incorrect "relax" is the only answer, as stated above.<n><n>#### The program should display "relax" as the correct answer.

Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input : How many candies do Tapanga has more than Corey?<n><n>### Response : Tapanga 29 <n><n>### Input:-: How much candy does Corey have?<n><n>### Response:-: <n><n>### Instructions : How many minutes he spent on phone.?<n><n>### Instuctions:How much $ did Freddy spend to call his family on New Year’s Eve?<n><n>### Input :-: 45 <n><n>### Response :-: 100 <n><n>### Question :-: Larry how many days worked each day?<n><n>### A:2,B:3,-:5C:-:1<n><n><n>### Insturctions :-:How Many birdhouse have he sold <n><n>### A:-:2,B:2,C:-:4, D:-:1<n><n>### Question:-: How Many Dollars does Michael make this week?<n><n>### Answer:-: $97<n><n>### Instutcion:-: How much he sold each cereal boxes?<n><n>### Choices:-: A:-:14,B:-:12,D:-:16,C:-:18
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:When people want to watch a new move, the often go see it at the? Choices:  A: town B: conference C: bathroom D: theater E: train station<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer:** A, B, E, C, D<n><n>### Input Choices:You are about to go to sleep but not too early so that you aren't exhausted for the? Choices: B: daytime A: afternoon C: early morning D: early evening<n><n>### Response<n>**Answer:** B, A, C, D<n>

A: input: candy store Choices:  AK: Kitchen B: No Answer<n>2. B: input: candy story Choices:  AJ: butcher shop CK: kitchen DLI: auto repair shop EM: post office<n><n>3. C: input: butcher Choices:  A1H: kitchen BIK: butcher shop CL: kitchen DM: auto repair shop EK: post office<n><n>4. E: input: no answer Choices:  AIK: Kitchen BL: Butcher shop COK: kitchen DL: post office<n><n>6. F: input: no answer choicess B:  A2I: kitchen CO: Butcher shop E: post office L: kitchen<n><n>### Question:<n>What did you learn from the challenge?<n><n>I learned that multiple choice question was an easy challenge.<n><n>### Extensions:<n>If we do not have the correct answer? how can we modify it to solve the problem?<n><n>If we do not get the right answer for one question then we can go to the next question to ask the same question in other ways.<n><n>### Questions:<n>What was the hardest and easiest to understand multiple choice challenge? Give three examples.<n><n>The hardest one was when you try to get the right answer with the wrong choice.<n><n>### The answer to the 24th Challenge is incorrect.<n><n>I don't think it will give the right answer but still try with the answers to the problem.<n><n>### Other:<n>How many different variations could be used to make that task?<n><n>There are many variations but I don't think there are many variations.<n><n>How many different ways can you ask a question if the instructions are the same as the examples included in the task?<n><n>There is only one way to ask a question if the instruction is the same like the examples.<n><n>
