Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer is A. He put it in the grocery store.<n><n>The answer is B. She was right.<n><n>The answer was B, because he knew what the answer was.<n><n>The answer had nothing to do with her, and the guy was right about not knowing an answer that doesn't make any sense.<n><n>### Input : Wanting to avoid the spoiling of cabbage, where did he put the cabbage? Choices: A: grocery storage B: refrigerators C: freezers D: dinner plates E: supermarket<n>### Response: Answer had nothing to do with him.<n><n>### Output: The answer does not pertain to him.<n><n>##<n>### Input: Dylan has 47 cats. He plans to give 8 cats to his sister, 6 at his grandmother's house, and 9 to the vet's office. How many cats is left after donating and selling these?<n><n>### Output<n><n>Dylan didn't actually give any cats away.<n><n>### Explaination:<n><n>The output is correct because Dylan's grandmother is too mean to want to keep cats.<n><n>Dylan's grandma has 5 more cats, 14 is greater than 9, so she would rather have more money than she would have to care for them.<n><n>##<n><n>### Instructions: Follow the instructions below to complete the following task.<n><n>### Task: Answer question 5 in the following conversation below.<n><n>### Conversation:<n>Tanya: Hey, is there milk left in the fridge? I've run low.<n><n>Kendall: I think so. How much?<n><n>Tanya: I think a gallon will be enough this time - not too much. I won't need any more tonight.<n><n>Kendell: A gallon is $3.99.<n><n>Tanya: Thanks!<n><n>### Question 1<n><n>Does she want to know the difference in the milk prices before or after the coupon?<n>### Question 2<n><n>Which amount does she want to know, the difference or the total amount she will pay this time?<n><n>### Question3<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The window across the street was broken and John felt guilty. He stands on one foot the entire day, alternating his left foot every 30 seconds. He starts with his left foot. How many times will he stand on his left leg before switching? Answer: 7<n><n>Input: A bird flies between a tree and a lamp post (the tree 96 ft away from the house the lamp post 152 fts away). How far does the bird fly (in feet)? How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where are small grapes used? Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		Choice A: picnic basket, B: juice, C: wine press, D: kitchen, E: fruit cocktail<n><n>### Instructions:Read the question and submit a response.<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes most likely to be used (i.e. the answer options)?<n>Answer: A.<n><n>Input: Which of the following is NOT a fruit?<n>Answer: C: A watermelon<n><n>Input: How many letters are in a word (i.e. Choice "B")?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>Input: On what side of the street are houses typically found (i.e. choice "F")?<n>Answer: D: On both sides of the street<n><n>Input: What is the opposite of a "bird"?<n>Answer: B: Lizard<n><n>### Input:(Read the question and submit your response.)<n><n>Input: In the summer in 2022, 10 years after the start of construction, the new gym will be complete. Fill in each blank with the number of the letter that corresponds to the correct answer choice, according to the examples. If you have any doubt as to the correctness of an entry, consult the Instruction that precedes the section.<n><n>### Output:Each response has a certain length. If it is too long, abbreviate it to the point that its clarity is not compromised. Write your responses clearly and accurately, in complete sentences. Use proper nouns and punctuation correctly. Remember to follow the directions of the question.<n><n><n>#### Question 1<n>```<n>Tapanga and Corey each have 66 candie. However, Tapagna has 8 more candie than Corey.<n>How many candies does Core do have?<n>```<n>Answer:<n>| Tapanga - Corey<n><n>| How many candies does  Corey have ?<n><n>```<n>Answer: 28<n>```<n><n>#### Question 2<n>```<n>Mattie worked a total of 3 hours each day. She worked 4.5 hours on Tuesday, and 6 hours on Wednesday.<n>How long would Mattie work the next day?<n>```<n><n>| A  | B  | C  | D  | E<n><n>| How long would Mattie work?<n><n>Answer: 6<n><n><n>#### Question3<n>```<n>Lawrence works Monday, Tuesday, and Friday. He works 8 hours each day.<n>He works 5.5 hours each day on Wednesday and Thurday.<n>What day does he work the same number of hours?<n>```<n><n>Answer: Friday<n><n>#### Question4<n>```<n>Ali had 900 books. He sold 46 on Monday, 90 on Tuesday, 54 on Wednesday and 60 on Thursday.<n>How many books did he sell?<n>```<n><n>```<n>Ans: 8<n>```<n><n>| Books remaining: | (A)<n>| ----------------<n>|  (B)<n>| --------------  <n>| Sell on...<n><n>Total(number of days )<n>| (A)   | (B)<n><n>| (A) | (C)<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		 B<n><n>Instruction:Write a response that uses the word provided in place of the one in the sentence.<n><n>### Input:"Kirby said no."<n><n>### Demostration:"He wouldn't have said yes if he could."<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question using the vocabulary word provided.<n><n>### Question:"How can you tell if people are lying?"<n>### Response:"Lying is a negative behavior."<n><n>### Output: "The dog is barking."<n>Expected Output: "The dog isn't barking."<n>

Her sister, Lia, has as many candies. Tamar has one half as many candies as Lia. How many candies do they have together?<n>## Input B: Lia has fewer than twice as many candies as Tamar. Together, they have exactly as many candies as their mom. How many candies are there in all?<n>## Response:<n><n>Sister Tamar has 6 candies, her sister Lia has 9 candies. Tamar and Lia have 2 candies altogether. Tamar and their mom have 11 candies in all.<n><n>### Reponse:<n><n>Tamar has 6 candys and Lia has 9. So they have 15 candys altogether. Aaron and Eric together, have 25 candys. Candys total: 25 and 15 = 40<n><n>### Instructions: Tapanga and Lia have $28 dollars. When they share their money, Lia has twice as much money as Tapanga. How much money does Tapanga have left?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Tapanga has $6, and Lia has $44 left.<n><n>### QuestionA: You are in need of a new bed and you are looking at two different beds. What is the total amount of colors you have in common?<n><n>### Response :<n>3<n><n>### Input  : One of your friends has the following 5 numbers in its birth month: 3, 7, 8, 18 and 24. Using arithmetic operations such as subtraction, addition and multiplication; find the numbers needed to replace them, that'll sum up to the number "40"<n><n>### Response  :<n>7-3 + 24 + 24-18 = 40<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Tapanga and Corey Have 66 Candies together. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where was the apple tree said to contain something forbidden? A: 3 B: 1 C: 34 D: 343<n><n>### Response:[622]  Choice B is correct<n><n>### Input:-16534+-13548+19105+20302=?<n><n>### Response:-16537<n><n>### Input:#Nine-Four-Seven+#Four-Nine-Seven...<n><n>### Response:#23#18#24#12.5#15<n><n>### Input:@59_335_2#@46+4#@1_77_7<n><n>### Response:@297#@11#@57<n><n>### <u>C</u>orrect<n><n>This task should only take you 15 seconds, give it your best effort. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How many candy Tapanaga and Corey gets?<n>Output: Tapanga and Correy get 66 candies and Ali kept 28 candy for himself.<n><n>### Input<n>There are 5 books on the shelves. There is 1 pear, 1 apricot, 1 peach, 12 plums, 10 mangoes and 1 grape on the counter. How many apples are on the counter?<n><n>### Demontration <n>Given the information from the question we will find the answer  in the following steps.<n><n>  1. There are 31 appes in the bag. <n>  2. There is one grape on the counter<n>  3. There are 30 appes on the counter<n>  4. There are 3 bananas, one pear, one apricot, one peach, 10 mangos, and two strawberries on the counter. <n>  5. There are 37 fruits in total.<n>  6. 1 apricot and 1 peach are the same 15 fruits in totel. <n> <n>### Check <n>1. <n>

How much money does he have left?<n><n>### Response : A correct answer<n><n>## Explanation:<n><n><div class="wp-block-customexcerpt"><n><b>Problem</b><!--<br>--><n>Aaron wants to know:  How much money does he get in change?<n><n><p></p><n><b>Solution</b><!--<hr />--><n>Write an expression.<n><n>\[53.95 + 2 + 6 = 53.<n>\]\[53.9 + 2 + 3 = 53.9 --><n><n><p></div><n><div class="customexcerpts-buttons"><n><a class="customexp-share-button" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fsharer.php%3Fu%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Falmaanabdullahi98.github.io%252Fcoding-questions-solutions-of-everyone-%2523solutions"><n><img src="/assets/images/facebook/facebutton.png" title="Facebook" alt="Facebook" width="50" height="50"><n></a><n><a class="twitter-share-button" @class="customexp share-button" href="https://twitter.com/share?url=http%3A//almaanabdullahicodingquestions.herokuapp.com/solutions" target="_blank"/><n><img src="/twitter/tweetbutton.png" title="" alt="" width="33" height="33"><n></a>	<n><n></div><n><n><n><n><n><n>

Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:He finally found someone as ugly as him, knowing he wouldn't be the one sticking out was what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What kind of radio does someone use to reach base? Choices:  A: vessel B: box C: transistor D: submarine E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>
